name: Bar Allioli
description: Wonderful little bar set in one of the most beautiful valleys in the world. Run by Paul (originally from the UK and speaks many languages) and his wife Synove from Denmark. If you have a day or two Paul can give you details of some wonderful walks. Enormous selection of beers from round the world, good cheap food and fast internet. Closed from 1700 on Monday and all day Tuesday.

name: Barcelona I Camping Masnou
description:
15 km to "Placa Catalunya", 35 min by R1 - Train (station: El Masnou, 5 min walk from Campground) - probably your best and most safe choise for Barca.

http://campingmasnoubarcelona.com/2015web/index.php/en/transportation

name: Madrid I Camping Osuna
description:
Very nice place!

11km to "Sol", 40 Minutes by Metro (green Line #5) starting at station Canillejas (10 min walk)
http://www.crtm.es/media/146302/serie_0a_esqmetro.pdf

~20€ / night

name: camping montillana
description: lovely campsite situated in the natural pak "sierra de las villas". a good place to relaxe and for hiking. nice and clean ablution blocks, restaurant, bar, shop, wifi, pool and a nice lake nearby. 3.85 €/person, 3 €/car, 3.75 €/tent. tel: 953 126 194

name: los cameros
description: nice quiet place in the natural park "sierra cebollera", all sites on grass, clean ablution block, bar, wifi (only @ the bar), 3.60 €/person, 4.60 €/coche cama

name: Cabo Da Gata Camper Park
description: friendly clean new place with about 40 flat gravel places. nice stay between agricultural greenhouses with grills and chill zone. washing maschine and dryer each 3.5€. you can order bread for breackfast at the reception. the night costs 7€ + 3€ electricity.

name: Hostal Tafalia
description: Double room 49 euro. Hotel with parking out front. They allowed us to put our motorcycles in a basement garage that was very secure (mostly used for general storage). Clean. Restaurant and bar onsite.

name: Parking Vallderrobres
description: Mostly flat dirt parking lot along the river and close to the old town. Camper vans and RVs are allowed 48 hours free. Not allowed to appear as camping though (chairs and other stuff outside). No services but there is a dump station. Great location to old town.

name: Parking Morella
description: Informal free camping/parking area for self contained campers. Mostly flat with some picnic tables and trees for shade. Located about 1.5 km an easy walk from the beautiful town and castle ruins of Morella. There is a free dump station and water spigot.

name: Valencia CamperPark
description: 15 euro per night with 4 amp electricity, can pay less for no electricity or more for higher amperage. Nice flat park, clean bathrooms/showers. Metro to the city a 5 minute walk away. Washing machine for 3 euro per load. Bar/restaurant makes really good paella.

name: Cabo De Gata Camping
description: The park has a bunch of amazing undeveloped beaches and lookouts that would be great for overnighting. Unfortunately camping in the park isn't allowed and we were told by other campers they come through at sunset and kick you out. All of the little towns in the park have a relatively flat gravel municipal parking lot at the beginning of town where sleeping over night is ok (at least in the low season. Not sure about the summer months). No facilities but no cost. There are also a handful of campgrounds scattered throughout the park. They are well signed.

name: Ronda Train Station Parking
description: You can park overnight in the parking lot in front of the train station. 9.10 euros. There is a bathroom inside the station. Not sure if it is open all night. Flat and relatively quiet. There were some campgrounds in the area also.

name: Olvera
description: There is an official camper parking next to the information office. Nice flat parking and for 7 euro you get electricity, water, and a dump station (grey water and cassette toilet). You can also park outside of the designated area for free and use the cassette toilet dump and nobody will bother you. Also flat parking and same great views.

name: Casa Tahivilla
description: Nice villa to rent with 3 bedrooms, in the middle of a cute and quiet white village. The owners are very friendly, the house is in a perfect state.

name: Càdiz Parking
description: Public parking lot near the port and the old town. Clean bathrooms available for use. 3 euro/24 hours for campers. It is conveniently located next to the old town but can be quite noisy. The trucks at the port start early, but it is a good spot to visit the old town which is well worth a stroll and the price is right.

name: Aduana for MAD moto cargo
description: Take passport, title, registration (must be current), green card (insurance - i bought mine online mototouring.com), and waybill (i used lufthansa cargo and swissport 5min walk away) to get clearance stamp

name: Camping Motel Sierra Nevada
description: Big place in town. Across the street from huge supermarket and bus station. Loud on weekends. 3 supermarkets nearby.

name: camping abogao
description: didnt stay

name: camping los aroncales
description: big spot next to fortress

name: Camping valdevaqueros
description: big place across from nice kitesurfing beach. lots of grass and shade

name: Camping sureuropa
description: This camping is operated by Asociación Pro-Personas con Necesidades Socio-Educativas Especiales y/o Dependientes del Campo de Gibraltar. (Disabled persons). The service is absolute correct and friendly. The place is clean and calm at night. Restaurant in walking distance (20 min). Pricing: Caravan 5.70 EUR / Person 4.70 EUR. Only approx. 4 places for 'bigger' caravans (we guess max. 7-8m). Total about 25 places.

name: Camping Torre De La Peña
description: Nice campground with spots right on the water and across the road on the hillside. Most spots are relatively flat. Clean bathrooms, great views, and some spots with shade. 23 euro a night with electricity in May 2016. Washers 3 euros and dryer 2 euros. There is also a very nice salon for campers connected to the restaurant with comfy chairs and a coffee machine.

name: La Chopera
description: For two people, two motorcycles and one tent it was 19.28. Nice place with all amenities of an established campground. We had tons of rain so didn't do any of the hikes that are easy to access from campground

name: Camping Vilsom
description: 28 euro per night for two people, two motorcycles and one tent. Expensive but near Seville. Mostly car campers and motor homes. Nice facilities and very clean bathrooms.

name: Casa De Fusta
description: Place for RV, no costs, with a restaurant next to the place

name: Camping Nuria
description:
It is an ideal place to put the tent, it has water, bath and shower. At about 200m there is a bar where you can have breakfast or eat although it is quite expensive. We went in a touristy time and they did not charge anything for that I do not know the cost. 

Es un sitio ideal para poner la tienda de campaña, cuenta con agua, baño y ducha. A unos 200m hay un bar donde puedes desayunar o comer aunque es bastante caro. 
Fuimos en una época poco turística y no nos cobraron nada por eso desconozco el coste.

name: Red Line Cars 4x4
description: Good quality service

name: Camping Playa America
description: Nice squeaky clean campsite. Grassy and shady. Pool and bar. Laundry etc. Friendly people

name: Camping As Cabazas
description: nice grassy area on a gentle slope above beach overlooking a pretty bay. cleanish facilities. limited shade. open field along main road so a small amount of traffic noise. lots of surfers in the water.

name: Santiago De Compostela Parking
description: Large parking lot for buses that allows camper parking overnight. Nothing special but quiet at night and close to the old center (about 1 1/2 km walking). 3 euro for the day only; 12 euro overnight. Overnight fee includes grey water and chemical toilet dump and water tank refill. If you arrive after 8:00 at night you only have to pay 3 euro for the day.

name: Beach Parking
description: Nice gravel parking lot next to the beach. Quiet and out of town. Spent a great night here.

name: camping
description: great spot near the beach if you kitesurf

name: Camping Covadonga
description: Nice place with lots of grass and shade. Clean bathrooms and area for dishes. Washing machine extra. 2 people and a camper without electricity 16.90 euros

name: Camping Naranjo De Bulnes
description:
Very nice place next to the Rio Cares. Lots of shade and grass. Clean bathrooms, washing machines, sinks for dishes with hot water. 
Still a very nice place. We paid around Euro 30.- 2 people, camper and electricity. Crossing the street there is a bar where you can eat small dishes.

name: Parking In Santillana Del Mar
description: Quiet parking lot near town. It seems like it is overflow parking for the high season. Flat, gravel, and lots of trees and quiet at night. Was empty at the end of June. Short walk to visit the old town. Free.

name: Parking Hondartzak (beach parking)
description: Parking lot overlooking the beach. Popular with surfers. There were quite few other vans and campers parked here overnight. Fairly flat and a nice view of the beach. Some bars/restaurants nearby. We were here on the night of fiesta San Juan so quite a lot of noise. I don't know if it's normal. Free 8 pm to 10 am, other times 0.70 euros an hour.

name: Faro Cabo De Santa Catalina
description: Parking for the lighthouse and bar/restaurant at the top. If you are short enough to fit in the parking spaces you are allowed to park as long as you want. Longer rigs can park on the shoulder but have to move during the day. You have to use levelers to get flat no matter where you park. Beautiful view and a short walk to town.

name: San Sebastian Municipal Caravan Parking
description: Official camper parking for the city. 6.55 euros per night no electricity. Potable water and grey water/wc dump. About 45 minute walk from the old town. Fast by bike with bike lanes into town or you can catch a bus; the stop is right out front. Fills up pretty early in the day so arrive early if you want a spot.

name: San Sebastián Parking
description: Parking lot on the point behind the port. Close to the old town. Flat spots overlooking the water. Parking is paid from 9am to 1:30 pm and 3:30 pm to 8 pm. We were told by a camper they slept there for a whole weekend no problems. We slept one night and were told by a police woman that camping was not allowed. As long as you pay and don't appear to be camping (chairs and blocks out) you are ok. Quite loud at night with traffic. Bathrooms nearby but are only open during the day.

name: Camping Bella Vista
description: Let's call it a luxury camping. Nice treat after a month morocco [sic]. EUR 29 standard pitch 2 pax low season. EUR 37 high season.

name: Camping Albufera de Anna
description: Campground in the hills next to a lake (public park, nice, no swimming). Shady lots under trees, ok infrastructure.

name: Tollo Pillete
description: Free. Valencia province park/camping. This is really set up for tents and day time picnics. There are sinks with water and toilets. The water was turned off in the toilets. They had been cleaned but weren't great. The showers were clean but no water. There was water in the large sinks by picnic area. We put our tent by picnic tables but ranger said they weren't really to be there but he let us stay. Very quiet with lots of shade. A camper car would be ok here.

name: Lake Caspe Camping & Bungalows
description: Menu pricing: in low season 5.3 euros per person, 5.7 euro per tent for two people if one person in tent it is 4, 4.2 per motorcycle. So for us 24.20 per night. Expensive but official camping in Spain is. Overall very nice site with a pool and on the lake. Access for fishing. There is a grill area with picnic tables. Dishes washing area and laundry area. Very clean bathrooms. Bar and restaurant. We ate at the restaurant and it was good. Lots of families and bass fisherman. There is wifi at reception but we didn't use it so I put average speed. It is crowded and there are lots of lights around so it is bright at night.

name: MNAC Parking Lot
description: Free parking by Catalonyan National Art Museum. Trees give a bit of shade, but there are no spots, which have it all day long. Lots of parks nearby. There is free wifi by the MNAC. Relatively quiet at night, but toilets are scarce and their opening hours vary (if they are open at all). The only ones we found opened on Sunday were located at Plaza Espana. Campers are forbidden from using the parking.

name: Camping Taull
description: Menu pricing. We paid 23 euro for two people,two motorcycles and a tent. Didn't try the wifi. Hot water in showers, sinks and for dishes. Tent camping and vehicle camping on grass. Beautiful place. Easy walk into Tuell. Lots of hiking.

name: Camping Collegats
description: Menu pricing. 5.6 euros per person plus your site. Full site is 13 euro per night but they also charge by half site which is half price. No problem for two motorcycles and a tent. A can would fit easy too. Tons of trees and shade. A really great relaxed atmosphere along a small river. There are people who have been coming here for 25 years. Pool, bar and restaurant. Very clean bathrooms with lots of sinks, toilets, showers, sinks for dishes and laundry. Hot water is solar. A really great place.

name: Bushcamp Tarifa
description: A hideaway 500 metres off the highway. You would never recognise this grassy camp behind and in high bushes. It has roundabouts and several camp pockets. Today there were 5 campervans here. Place for about 10 to 20 cars. Very clean and quite.

name: Quiet Car Park By City Beach
description: Parked up at the end of the road that leads to the town beach. The car park is next to a flat block but it is quiet and peaceful overnight. 5 mins walk to town with bars shops and cafes, and there's a nice path leads up to the hill -easy stroll in the woods with sea view.

name: El Oasis 2
description:
Perfect place to stop and have a nice breakfast (tostada con tomate), a great lunch, try one of their sandwiches or just a coffee; all at the best price. And if you want the perfect souvenir get the best Andalucian olive oil here.
Don't miss the opportunity to speak with Raimundo, the owner, he is a traveller and passionate about motorbikes.

NOTE: Avoid the petrol station next to the restaurant, it is one of the most expensive on this road.

name: Camping Iznate
description: Euro 19.81 per night for a plot that includes two people, vehicle (and they considered two motorcycles as one vehicle so no additional cost), and a tent. Quiet place with good views. Clean bathrooms, washing up area.

name: camping libre gratis
description:
Bathrooms, tables, chairs, drinking water. Free. This fenced but open door for camping
Baños,  mesas,  sillas,  agua potable.  Gratis.  Esta vallado pero puerta abierta para camping

name: Sird Auto S.L
description: It is a family-run business. Good service. Ask for David.

name: Between  Saravillo y  Sin
description: Very quite for a good rest next to the river. Water is quite cold but feels really good to wet your feet in the river while coats wander around.  Further up driving on a very steepy road we arrive to Sin, where beautifull views of the valley await for us.

name: mirador
description: small mirador parking lot with amazing views, good for the night, but you're probably not alone

name: Partida Poblas
description: Old beach boulevard, has seen better days. Lost fisherman, trash and nudist now reside here off season. Fine for a night at the beach.

name: Complejo Leo
description: Free camping in truck stop car park. 24hr cafe. Don't park too close to the buildings as it's noisy

name: Motel Emporio
description: Private ensuite garages and right next to the motorway. 50euro but can be booked online cheaper through various websites. Probably not aimed at tourists but visitors wanting more discretion and maybe to pay by the hour. Still secure parking and somewhere dry to do any maintenance. Hope they don't mind brake fluid in the bath!

name: CEUTA, overnight free parking
description:
Free parking,  in front of a tennis club. Quiet during the night.
Showers could be possible during opening hours of the tennis club.
Water at the dog's training ground nearby.

name: pine forest
description:
it's off the road, quite, and OK.
not the nicest forest ever, rather a plantation.
it's a bit off-roady to get deeper in, don't attempt in a big rig (especially in a wide and low one) or if u don't like branches scratching your paint. if u go further up, there are some spot with great views!
didn't even have to look the other way to not see 'dont enter'- signs. guess not allowed anyhow.

name: Mountain Parking Cocó de Jordi
description:
A big parking place in the mountains for hiking. At the dead end of a road. The place is made out of gravel, big enough for about 15 cars and the surrounding is beautiful. Most of the place is not level but a few spots are almost. There is a sign with some rules, saying that camping is forbidden (a crossed tent sign). 
There is traffic during the day, but we were alone in the night.

name: Beach
description: An area which is very common with wildcampers. You can follow the red walking track which is basically a gravel road. From there you will find many tracks leading to small bays. Some are full with campers that seem to spend the winter here, some are 4wd only. The marked place was the right one for us: Reachable with our 2wd camper, quiet and lonely with mountain and sea view.

name: Camper-Parking at Carlos Ferries
description: lots of lots of campers overnighting next to Lidl supermarket there before they go to Morocco. Close to a good shop (Carlos) for ferry-tickets. Not so good for rooftents because it is very loud from the harbour and busy all night.

name: Puerto de Tiscar
description: A small place to camp for a night at the top of the Mountain pass at 1190m high. There is a fuente (spring / water source) just down the hill at the abandoned restaurant. The nearby old moorish watchtower is really worth the walk up. Amazing views.

name: El Alcazar Recreationa
description:
A beautiful, big parking place in the middle of the national park. There is everything you might wish for: Toilets, cold shower, water from the mountains, a playground BBQ places. There are actually two parking place. Both are large and quite level. Reachable by good gravel roads. 
Could be full during season but we were the only ones in February. Park ranger was greeting friendly...

name: Camping Sierra Maria
description: Beautiful campground in a forest. No noise at all. Refurbished bathrooms. Warm hearted owner. Good possibilities of walks in the surrounding. Very clean. Potable tab water. The swimming pool is opened in summer. Barbecue area nearby. Next village Maria 5 minutes by car for basic shopping, better Velez Rubio 20 minutes. In Velez Blanco interesting ancient wall paintings "Cueva de los Letreros" in a cave (guides on Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday). Low season offer with ACSI Campingcard 17 € (2 adults, plot, electricity).

name: Camping La Vinuela
description:
Campsite on hillside hard standing looking over the lake and mountains. Beautiful spot. All facilities. Acsi accepted. 
Out of season rates 180 euros for a month electric extra on that deal. 
Lovely local restaurant good prices with same view.
Animals welcome.

name: Sandbar parking
description:
Parallel to the dead end streat there is a sand road made wide enough for parking. Enough space for hundret RV's. To one side you will have the dunes and access to the beach, to the other there is the road (low traffic) and you can see the industrial harbor. Some locals come to fish or chill. 

CORRECTION: In the middle of the night the oil refinery on the mainland loaded a ship so we wake up from the engine sound and an awful oil smell.

name: Viajas Normandie (Carlos)
description:
The famous Carlos and his travel agency. Usually the cheapest ferry booking. Open return to Tangier Med, one person and moto. €80. Bring cash.

Near supermarkets. Nice guys

name: Camping Fronterra
description: On road just south of Andorra, a little noisy by the road but friendly and good value at €15 for 2 people and car.  Free wifi at bar/reception.

name: Igueldo San Sebastián Camping
description: €19 pn for 2 people and car.  All facilities but road can be busy during day but is quiet at night.  Really good wifi, showers could be hotter and no soap in bathroom (seems normal in Spain and France..).  Bus takes you straight into city and back (€1.70 each way).

name: Camper area M&H El Rincon
description: Brilliant camper stop. Friendly welcome, lovely beach half a km away. Spotless loo and shower. Handy shop at reception but supermarket nearby too. 10 euros and 3 for ehu. Washing machine and dryer available. There was a great BBQ when we visited. Fresh bread, pizzas etc available too.Thoroughly recommend it. Be careful as some satnavs try to direct you up a steep narrow way. Best to continue to roundabout where you'll see a mororhome emptying sign

name: Almerimar
description: Official Vans and RV parking near the sailboat port office and front the sand beach.

name: Cádiz Parking near the Parador and facing the sea with sep. area for Camper
description: Price 6 m €14,40 bigger cars 28,80 for 24 h /  quiet, light at night.

name: Praia da Balea
description:
A small parking lot (maybe 3 cars) at the side of the gravel road next to a nice sandy beach. Almost level. Sea view. A little wind protection by bushes. There are a few more parking lots like it along this road. 
If you are in this area you should not miss driving along this gravel road which goes along the coast line and gives you beautiful landscape views and crosses lonely beaches.

name: Clearing at the ocean
description: What a nice place to stay! In the forest very close to the ocean. A footpath leading down to it. You will need some ramps to get your car level and maybe 4wd to get back up the track if it's rainy. Expect some mussel fishers to come by but no one else.

name: Motorhomes parking
description: Carpark for motorhomes. Free. No facilities. Good location to spend one night before going to Morocco or when coming back. Supermarkets nearby.

name: Camping Valle Anisclo
description: Very nice campsite. Some pitches have electric. Water points and chemical disposal

name: Zamora Cale De Los Pisones
description: A car park where you can park at night, recommended by the tourist office of Zamora shops at two hundred meters a park with children's playground, without any service

name: Castellar de la Frontera
description: Useful place to empy/fill before or after the ferry to Morocco. Free services and parking for up to 72hr. 23 spaces. Quiet residential area. Not available first week in May because of a local festival.

name: Casa Costa Blanca Appartement
description: very nice place, very nice hosts, perfect Appartement for two

name: Ribera del chanza
description: Picnic site by a river just over border from Portugal

name: Camping parque ardales
description: Nice campgroud near the entrance to the Caminito del Rey. Campsite with electricity, clean toilets/hot showers and direct access to the lake Embalse de Guadalhorce. Price depends on season: 3-5 €/person + 3-5/car + 3 for electricity.

name: Alosno 3 km after cemetery river side
description:
near River nobody around fire owood not allowed good road After is gravel road 
au bord de la rivière personne aux environs route goudronnée après le gué c'est de la piste feu de bois intdrdit

name: Dolmen Pozuelo
description:
5 6 km de piste moyenne véhicule 6.50. m pas plus sur l'aire d'entrée d'un des 3 sites
la nature et les oiseaux
5_6 km gravel road véhicule non more 6.50 are front thé entrance of one of thé 3 sites
nature and birds

name: Berrocal
description: À parking south entrance  Village ,2 foutains drinking water.Un parking entrée sud du village il y a deux fontaines dans le village

name: 3km Aznalcollar
description:
on the lake quiet birds sheeps 
au bord du lake tranquille les oiseaux les moutons

name: Areas Autocaravana Sevilla
description:
an horrible area like à cattle
 Park 1 toilettes
un horrible Park de stationnement un seul WC
12  e power elec 3

name: Lake side camp
description:
Lovely little spot by the lake. A dirt road runs from the main road and opens out next to the lake.
There's a lot of flat area to park and pitch tents.

name: Vale Verde Coripe
description:
à Big area for picknick  acces by à gravel road 1 km After hotel
une grande air
e de pique-nique accessible par une bonne piste 1 km après l'hôtel

name: Ubrique
description:
à large parking 2 minutes walking to down town bigs rigs allowed possibility dumping 
un grand.pafking à 2 mn à pied du centre ville possibilité de vidange

name: Algeciras port pour Tanger
description:
Inter Shipping delay and less customer than FRS
to buy the seats at the port counter and not in an agency
Inter Shipping late ticket on the Harbor offices

_______

Inter Shipping retard et moins de client que FRS 
bien acheter les places au guichet du port et non pas dans une agence
Inter Shipping late buy ticket on the Harbor offices

name: Talleres Victoria
description: Really nice mechanic guys. Their main profile is fixing agricultural machinery but they also do cars. They actually helped me with my motorcycle. Seem to work till late. Only speak spanish.

name: Camping Victoria
description: Nice, small, relaxed camping. Maybe a little noisey for it's right next to a road. By the entrance there's a local restaurant-bar.

name: Vila de Sarria Camping
description: Relaxed, quiet, small camping by the edge of Sarria. Big trees with plenty of shades. Nice communal building/restaurant. Paid 11 euro for 1person/1motorcycle/1tent

name: Alhama de Granada recinto ferial
description:
Car parking with a corner for camper vans 100 m above à fountain.

Un parking avec un coin pour camping car WC public 100 m au-dessus une fontaine.

name: Embalse de los Bermejales
description:
At the edge of the dam.

En bordure du lac du barrage à 500 m un camping

name: Lanteria
description:
Near soccer field 200 m after the end of the paved road with the permission of a farmer.

Près du terrain de foot 200 m après la fin de la route goudronnée avec la permission d'un cultivateur.

name: cabo de gata
description: Nice and clean. 26 Euros for 2 people, car and tent.

name: Nijar road of Torre
description:
In the middle of nowhere on the road to the Torre are many places to park at 15 min from the quiet and free sea.
3G network available.

Au milieu de nulle part sur la route de la Torre de nombreux endroits pour stationner à 15 mn de la mer tranquille et gratuit.

name: El Sur Camping
description: Big but nice camping with swimming pool and good facilities. About 1 km from the city. It's a little expensive and you have to pay for wifi which I don't find to be nice. But this is the only camping place around here...

name: Sanctuario Santa Eulalia
description:
asked to souvenir shop it's OK
à Big parking on the wood on the night you est ring thé Bell for your soul cleaning 😎
demande autorisation au magasin de souvenir vaste parking dans un bois de conifères la nuit  le son des cloches pour purifier nos âmes😎

name: Camping Sierra de Penascosa
description: Super-nice, quiet, family-run camping with lot of trees, shade, birds and a small creek. There's no on sight bar and restaurant but Pescadores is only 10 minutes walk away. If you're looking for a big, industrial kind, party camping than this is not it! If you want  to be in a tiny island of peace far away from anything than this is your place...

name: Ermita Santa Filomena
description:
i think this Ermitage have à great parking,nothing, i ask périple who live near it's OK and they offer
 if we need water
je pensais que il y avait un grand parking devant cet Ermita rien du tout on a demandé aux voisins si on pouvait stationner sur la plateforme attenante, OK ils nous ont même proposé de l'eau si on avait besoin

name: Water. Hidden tent spot
description: Hidden camp spot above spring, good for cyclists camp

name: Planes
description:
sur une ancienne portion de route face au lac du barrage
on an Old road front thé lake

name: El Piusapo
description: Local restaurant and bar free but we eat at the restaurant. Owner is very friendly and offered us water to fill up. Toilets in restaurant. Closed on Mondays. Only 1.5km to the start of Ronda.

name: 1,2 km north La Brava
description:
un parking à 50 m de la plage c'est propre
50 m beach à clean gravel parking

name: Valencia beach
description:
un parking gratuit en bordure de mer sur le malecon mieux que de rester en ville , plus chaud, nombreux restaurant et commerces dans les rues autour, la plage à 30 m
à free parking on the beach of Valencia, best than stay on free parking down town, many restaurants and shops streets around beach 30 m

name: Hotel Pirineos
description: Super-nice hotel on reasonable prices. Nice small town.

name: Barrage Ribesalbes
description:
Aire de Pique-nique au bord du lac de barrage table BBQ 
picknick area on lake side table and 
BBQ

name: San Mateu Ermitage Virgen Angels
description:
300 m de l'Ermitage en pleine nature dominant la plaine eau disponible à l'Ermitage gratuit
300 m Ermitage on a Hill above the valley water near ermitage free

name: Berga Resort
description: Big-euro, industrial size resort with top of the line facilities.

name: Camping Stel
description: Big size camping with good infrastructure...

name: rambla Ruidecols
description:
coming from Reus After runabout "la Vergonya" maps.md  take gravel road on right go underground thé bridge on your left and continue 1 km on the "rambla" quiet place with Wilde rabbit
en venant de Reus après le rond-point "la Vergonya" maps.me prendre dans un virage un chemin à droite qui descend dans le lit du Rio prendre à gauche sous le pont puis 1 km tranquille avec des Garennes

name: Camping Cadaquès
description:
So far the only official camping site in Cadaquès. May need a little refurbishment.
Sites just big enough for a standard-size camper van plus a small awning. 5 minute walk from the city center (10 minutes back uphill). Wifi extremely slow; only 10 minutes per day included.

name: la Cala Camper parking
description: Nice parking for Campers 5 minutes walk to village, shops and beach. Free. with water and dumping facilities which are difficult to spot but it's a manpole near to the wc.

name: Great place
description: Wild camping perfect for a night, next to a river.

name: Calle E, Lago Barasona
description:
There are multiple compacted roads at different levels of the hill, all unused, except there is one building at the lowest level.
Nice view of the lake, especially at sunset.
You can hear some dogs barking late into the night.

name: Camping Port de la Vall
description: Nice tiny camping/caravaning place with direct access to the beach. Full service, restaurant & grocery store inside. Price for motorhome in high season starts at 40 EUR.

name: General workshop
description: General workshop for an emergency

name: Riverside parking place
description: Big parking place for campers and motorhomes. Drinking water from a fountain. Garbage collection point. Fly fishing only with valid permit.

name: Marina Parking
description: free parkinglot at the marina! we had no chance to find a camping so we stay here. also longer campervans who need 2 parkinglots can park here. no toilets/showers/water but right in town.

name: cala joncols
description: Near cala joncols hostel you can sleep in your car.

name: Riaza, campeseo
description: Riaza, campeseo, campground with all faccilities, swimming pool, etc

name: Seaside view
description: Empty plot next to the beach. Wonderful view on the bay. Bar and restaurant nearby. Running water within 100m on the beach.

name: La Fresneda Camping
description:
Finally!  a camp ground that isn't trying to be tourist resort!  Run by a Dutch couple who speak good English, Spanish and likely German and French.  

beautiful location, well organised, no loud music and silence after 11pm, kids on site were well behaved.  spots are spacious and if you don't have extension lead they will provide one - so electric possible at every site. 

plunge pool is really good.

name: Camping Saturraran
description: Near to the road, easy to find - but the road is quite dangerous - was a good place to sleepy one night, shower is good, but restroom does not have soap. Near to the nature and 10 min to the beach.

name: Praia de area maior
description: Small stretch of area to park camper vans next to roads and dunes/shrubs with a short walk 50m to white sandy beach. Cold showers and water available at beach. Small clean surf great for beginners.

name: Arsenal de Moris
description: Grassy field just above a beach. Designated for camping. Multiple beach showers available but restrooms are closed for the season. A couple of other camper cans on site.

name: Camping Muineires
description: Beachside camping. Small campsite with room for maybe 20 RVs/vans. Free showers, very clean. Direct access to a beautiful beach. Paid €24 for one night. Free wifi in the bar and terrace but not at sites.

name: Camping Eucaliptus
description: Nice campsite in trees, beach is nearby, you can ride with bicycle, walking or by your own car. Some spots at the beach needs 4WD but the main road is ok for all kind of cars.

name: CASA Isabelle - Restaurant
description: We had dinner at Casa Isabelle and asked the waiter if we could stay overnight at the parking. He said that it would be ok and no one will close the parking. We've had a good and quite night here.

name: Camping Sierrecilla Humilladero
description: Quiet location with nice flat gravel shadow spots under trees. Facilities are ok. Paid off season with ACSI card €15 per night. Close the ‘laguna’ (dry salt lake). Supposed to see flamingo’s, but have not checked yet...

name: Parking Madrid - IBERICAN OVERLANDERS
description:
Overlanders Parking. Hi! We are Mar & Luis , we are overland travellers and offert a safe and private outside parking in our house. If you want to take a rest in your travel you  can leave your vehicle for 1 day or  even for 12 months. Avaliable for motorbikes and trucks. We can also transfer you to the Adolfo Suarez airport in 20 min. Our prices are: Motorbike 30€/month; Car 50€/month; Campervan/4x4 <6meters 60€/month; Truck 100€ month.
You are welcome and we would like to share oveland adventures!.
You need to contact us for reservation: +34661787395; mar.s.hurtado@gmail.com.

name: Campervan Parking
description: Free formal campsite with basic facilities and close to town centre and big supermarket (Consum). Lots of space, shadow, flat, calm and quite during the week. Tourist info at 10 minutes walking: possible to visit the historic underground wine cellars (it is worthy). Non guarded but totally safe. The perfect stop-over when doing Madrid-Valencia or heading south (Sevilla/Granada) from Barcelona.

name: Parking place in Blanes
description: Municipal parking where you van spero overnight. It was well signed named "Les Pines" in Blanes center.

name: Marbela - Cyclists ONLY
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Use Google maps satellite pic to find this place!!

It is in the end of a off road track on the  mountains of Marbella. Very easy to get here, it's steep though. There are 2 ways (what I've seen), one a trekking path the other one an off road, it does not matter which one you take cos both connected at one point.
to get there by the trekking path you have to go  the top of the Calle Padre Paco Ostos and there will be the path. Go up and in the first fork take the left (still going up) then when you get to the top it will be the off road junction turn left and all the lefts you find until you get there.
It's very flat and with an amazing view of Marbella and the sunset.

name: Playa del Gobernador
description: Nice place very close to beach. Noisy. Free. Toilets exclusively for guests to the restaurant.

name: Malaga beach
description: park area. not official. locals stay the night over. shower on beach.

name: Mechanic
description: Mechanic just off the road to Ronda, nothing special but my van was leaking oil and I just came across these guys. No English spoken whatsoever.

name: Almocita
description: Nice place nice landscape good and clean toilet service. The people are very friendly.

name: GNV & Grimaldi ferry port
description: Ferry port for GNV & Grimaldi lines ferries for tangier med. one can take their motorcycle, cars, trucks or campers onboard

name: faro de carbonera
description: free camping by the beach with nice views

name: España
description: camping and bungalows. reception 24 hours. bar and restaurant the 10 to 21 hours. good comunicatión

name: La Cerezal
description:
Not the greatest place to spend money on. The owner of this restaurant enjoys killing wolfs and hosting people to do the same, for later, boast of his bravery.

Sick.

name: Lavomatic - self serve laundry
description: Washers and dryers. Good dryers. 8 and 14 kilo washers.

name: Camping Vall de Ribes
description:
Friendly camping close to the woods, for nature lovers. Level parcels with a lot of shade in summer, cool at night. Warm showers, flush toilets, dish washing room, washing machine, place to drain caravan toilet, tap to refill water. Approx. 18 Euro for land Rover with roof tent and 2 persons.
They also have wooden bungalows. Very friendly owners.

name: lake proserpina Merida
description: Camping with all facilities. Old but clean. Ok but nothing special. Out of town. Merida has quiet a lot to discover! EUR 17 for 2 incl power. Noisy from road and dogs. Open all year.

name: Sevilla - Near Club Nautica
description: Free parking near the Club Nautica de Sevilla. Excellent for big rigs with everything on board. No amenities, just a big parking lot.

name: RC Miguel Angel
description:
Cheap, very clean and friendly hostel,
14 € per night, incl. simple breakfast! Parking for bikes close to hostel possible. Seems to be safe!

name: Termas Potes-La hermida
description: Small parking very close to thermal bath near Potes. Free, very quiet and a water tap available.

name: Camping Ciudad de Zaragoza
description:
Good camping, open all year. Reception open from 8am till midnight.
32€ for 1 camping car and 2 adults.

name: Embalse de valdecaballeros
description: Free camping at the lakeside, nice view very good for big rigs

name: Plays de burriana
description: Small parking area near the beach , normal size parking but kerb behind so vans up to 7.4 M ok

name: Pradollano ski
description: This is the upper parking lot for the Pradollano ski area. It is free just for the night, 10€ to stay the day (but you can easily park for free just outside the parking lot during the day. The toilets of the small snackbar are decent, clean, heated and open during the night. There is a water tap too(inside). The ski lift is just here. There is a stall to buy the ski pass (forfait) (46€) next to the snackbar, but is not always open. If closed you need to go down again to buy the forfait. Ski rental is either down at the main station, or inside the youth hostel next to this parking (20€ aday). This place is popular with campervans. On a weekday in January there were >20 staying the night. Constant freezing temps in winter - this is at 2400meters and partially above the ski pistes. Great views over ski area and Granada, great sunset too.

name: Embalse De Yesa
description: Stopped here for a swim.  Lots of scrubby trees with plenty of space for camping.  Several camper vans were parked up near here.

name: Hostal Pepe
description: Just what you need,clean,quiet and safe garage for motorbike!👍😎

name: Quiet parking lot
description: A quiet ground parking lot, leveled and clean, bushes all around.

name: Camping Alpujarras
description: Fantastic campground with good wifi & great hot water showers, they have a bar & restaurant with a communal area. The camp also as bungalows & stands are nice & flat. There is also a large dorm for the budget minded and the owners are terrific & help in any way they can. The camp looks over a spectacular valley with a view of the Mediterranean in the distance!

name: Camping Bahia de la Plata
description: Nice and big campsite anext to the beach, with two different sections. I think the second section (southern section) is slightly cheaper. Low season 22 Euro for 2 people and one unimog. The campsite has a restaurant, supermarket and WIFI near the reception. Restaurant is closed in low season.

name: by the lighthouse
description: you can park next to the lighthouse. Great views, not many people there when we stayed here. 2.8 km from the street. There's also a nice grassy area.

name: Delta Ebro
description: free parking in front of the sea, quiet and peaceful

name: Los Batanes, Lagunas de Ruidera
description: big and nice Campsite,  good and clean ablutions,  flat sites with water and electricity,  in a wonderful landscape ,playpark, supermarket,  20 Euro for 2 people and car incl. Electricity

name: Auto Solar
description: We bought our service battery. They have lots on stock. Really nice and friendly. Spanish and Italian speaking.

name: Petrol Station
description:
This is a big petrol station with parking only for campers and vans and it has dump station and water to refill
You can find free wifi.
Playground for kids
There is an hot shower, cost 3€ per shower without towel and soap.

name: Requena parking
description: great parking to visit the city, suitable for large vehicles

name: Alarćon
description: great parking to visit the castle, suitable for large vehicles

name: Camping Noria
description: wonderful place  with absolutely everything you need, good restaurant, friendly staff, not so expensive,  perfect

name: Camping L`Albera
description: Nice and well-priced campsite,  good Ablutions, very quiet, many trees, restaurant was closed. fast Wifi for 4 Euros a day.

name: Las Valerias
description: Green lawn inside a quiet and peaceful canyon under Roman ruins

name: La bombilla
description:
Parking lot with small kiosko, beach and sweet water showers.
Good for filling up water tanks

name: Prangerte
description: Good oranange tree in the middle of a a meadow. Place to camp anywhere in the pine forest nearby

name: Una
description: off-road parking, quiet next to the lake

name: Nice campsite flat ground and grass
description: Nice campsite with views over mountains. Opportunity for campfire. Easy access with 4x4

name: Camping Las Lomas
description: Great camping at beautiful location with restaurant, small shop and swimming pool.

name: Vilanova Park
description: Large campsite with indoor and outdoor swimming pools. Restaurant/bar showing English football. All the usual amenities you would expect from a big site. We chose it from the Camping & Caravan Club winter brochure and spent 15 days here to qualify for the reduced rate. We had the grandchildren for 6 days and there was lots for them to do. Wi-fi is expensive but you can get an hour free with a drink at the bar v

name: Grassy spot next to the road and river
description: Good spot for cyclists, vehicules won't be able to go that far. Pretty large grassy spot. River nearby. Not visible from the road even if you can hear it.

name: Volker Meyer
description: Nice vacation apartments. Ideal for families. World travelers, adventurers and bikers welcome.

name: Mercadona Parking
description: Free overnight parking next to Mercadona supermarket.  No facilities no bother from police.    Have stayed here many times both before entering and when returning from Maroc and also just for a good food/drink stocking up day

name: Playa del Regaton
description:
Camping located in the Natural Park of the marshes of Santoña, Noja and Joyel. You will be in the middle of nature, but close to Bilbao (70 Km)
Santander (54 Km). So what you want is tranquility, good views and nature will be a discovery. The beach Salvé is located at 1500 m. We offer you the highest category in comfort, with plots of 70 m2 each with its sink, water intake, drainage, electricity, free wifi and some modern services that will surprise you.

name: 33749 Tapia de Casariego Spain
description:
Beautiful vue on seaside+rocks. 
No facilitys. 
Please keep clean.

name: villarobbledo
description: very big parking asphalted with light near cementary. very quiet at night. easy for big rig

name: santuario ntrs sign del pueyo
description: incredible place by the santuario. on the top of the hill. nobody. on dirty lot. very quiet. free

name: Camping La Playa
description: The Camping & Bungalow & Albergue Turistico La Playa is located in the city of Logroño, capital of La Rioja and has all the advantages of the city but at the same time enjoys its location on the banks of the Ebro River. It is a 10 minute walk to be in the old town and the famous Calle Laurel for Pinchos.

name: Camping Cases
description:
The campsite was built in 1967 and family run, occupies a total area of ​​21,500 m2, mainly characterized by its lush vegetation.

Nearby are the municipalities of Alcanar, Sant Carles de la Rapita, Peñíscola and Vinaròs where you can enjoy local cuisine and where you will find various leisure activities that will make your stay more enjoyable. The campsite is near the Natural Park of the Ebro Delta, one of the most important aquatic habitat of the western Mediterranean

name: Viewpoint and small campground
description: Small track goes down to the water. Good place to have a lunch. Looks like normally water access is fenced, but when we came the fence was open. Visible from the road.

name: Refugio de Pesca
description: A better place to have a lunch. Tables, barbeque spots, stream and small waterfalls. A couple of places for small motorhome (informal). No GSM networks. Some wild animals (deers?) were spotted.

name: Las Negras
description: Awesome free park close to the beach and city center.

name: Venta del Alto - Hotel Las Cumbres
description:
Good place to stay on the way to south Spain or Marocco. Good restaurant and family friendly atmosphere. We parked the motor trailer and  the car for almost two weeks (for free). Super parking for overland trucks, etc. Fair prices. Bikers friendly place!!! 👍

Web: http://www.ventadelalto.com

name: Camping Sierra Espuña
description: Small, family-run campsite in the middle of Sierra Espuña with very nice walks that start right here.

name: Picnic area
description: Picnic area among eucalypts, upper part. Place to park a car, barbeque, tables. May be crowded on week ends.

name: Customs
description: You can get your final CPD verification here when coming from Africa.

name: Ebro Bridge
description: Parking Lot for campers. The nearby road is not that busy. There is next to the square a beautiful old bridge and a green area with tables and seating. It's free.

name: Monasterio de San Salvador de Leyre
description: A large parking lot next to a monastery. The Way of St. James is also there. In the morning the bells of the monastery ring, but until then you should be awake anyway.

name: Tap outside English Options
description: Water from ornate vintage style push button tap.

name: La Buca Vecchia
description: Spacious pitches round the back of a farm house. Campground run by the family and cost €20 for two people, one camper for one night. Beautiful views, very friendly owners - perfect spot!

name: Camping site, next to road
description:
There is a path that runs next to the "main" road to allow bigger rigs to pass the river without having to cross the bridge. If you pass the river with the bridge on the right side, continue 50 meters and on the left you can place 2 decent sized rigs and 2 tents. 
Keep the place clean!

name: Camping valle de Nocito
description: Nice quiet camping ground. €36 for 2 cars, 4 persons, 1 tent.

name: Entrambasaguas, near Reinosa, Cantabria
description: Rustic meadow site surrounded by beautiful mountains. Beautiful and peaceful valley setting. Birdsong in the morning is magnificent. Shower block was basic but clean. There were no other vans or tents on the site when we came so total seclusion. The owners main business seems to be rustic holiday cabins and cottages at a distance from the site. I don’t think campers turn up very often because it’s not signposted or advertised anywhere. The owners seemed surprised we found it.

name: Playa de Santibañez
description:
Free Parking at the Beach. 
There are toilets, but only open till 21.00

name: Meadow near forgotten finca
description: Nice place with late sunset just next to a gravel road between Spain and Andorra. Small creek running next to it, but no mosquitoes.

name: Castro de santa Tecla (santa Tegra)
description: Parking allí web. No facilities. Espléndido landscape. Surge and quiet un the night

name: Area de servicio Ribadesella
description: Dump station close to the city center with 5 parkings

name: Ribadesella
description: 5 dedicated caravaning parkings with dump station. Parking is free, local passes by. Might be a bit noisy during day and calmer as night. 10-15min Walk to the city center.

name: El Molino de Cabuérniga
description: Beautiful, laid back, remote site in a mountain valley near a river. Clean but basic shower block and 6A electrical hook up. Restaurants on the doorstep and others nearby. I sense this was once a well kept campsite but is less well looked after these days. But it’s very charming because it’s so rustic and chilled. We stayed twice and were the only campers both times. Very good for a stopover from or to Santander ferry. And friendly welcoming owners.

name: Camping Ancoradoiro, near Louro
description: Camping site. In off-season nice parking to stay. No toilets, no water. A stunning beach!

name: Mountain and desert views
description: Wild camping spot. Short off-road to get here from the highway, no 4-wheel

name: Las Médulas Parking
description:
Parking lot for visitors of the Area arround las Médulas. 
Lot of dogs in the small village.

name: Camping Igara
description: A wonderful campsite in the middle of the mountains, very green. Quiet but with all the facilities you could wish for. Two spaces for pitching tents, away from the car (you park up) and it’s a very short walk to the tent area. Helpful staff. And a free shuttle into San Sebastián!

name: Old bridge
description: Campsite is next to the old bridge. Nice and quiet. No facilities. A swim in the lake is recomended. The village Herrera del Duque is at 10 km.

name: Camping Rio Jara
description: A good place, reasonably priced for Europe at this time of year, 23 euros for one motorcycle and tent, elec is extra, clean showers and toilet. Huge beach, morning good for bathing, full on kite surfing in the afternoon. It's an established campsite.

name: Faro de Lastres
description: great sea view, wounderful place, no facilities

name: Free water and dump station
description: Five parking spaces to overnight on gravel parking lot of a vineyard . Free dump station and water.

name: Small area next to the water.
description: Just off he road there are some small areas to park and camp. Not sure if camping is allowed but we had not problem for he night and there were other vans camped overnight aswell.

name: Cabañeros Lincetur Centro de Turismo Rural
description:
The Lincetur campsite is set on the edge of Navas de Estena in the Montes de Toledo, on the edge of the Cabañeros National Park, and next to the Camino del Boquerón hiking route.

The campsite is comfortable. there are about eight cabins and plenty of open spaces for vehicle camping, with some shaded areas for tents under holm oaks (encina) there were electricity point throughout.  The shower and toilet block was clean and well maintained.  There are also black and grey water disposal facilities.

The bar and restaurant is excellent, specialising in local venison (venado) and wild boar (jabalí).  It is also seems well patronised by local residents from Navas de Estena.

Spring to early summer is probably the best time to see this area, it is hot and dry in Summer (but you will appreciate their excellently maintained swimming pool).  If you find yourself passing through this area or are looking for a stop off in central Spain, this campsite is worth the detour.

name: Free water
description: Free water in the Paisatge Natural Protegit Serra del Maigmo park.

name: Wildcamp
description: About 80m off the road. No cell service. Space for two VW Bus/Defender etc. Very quiet. Walking trail nearby.

name: Camping la campina
description: Quiet site, pool, restaurant, bar, electricity hook up, WiFi, clean and pleasant place.

name: Embalse de Yesa
description: Off main road informal campsites and a boat launch. Not kept, not regulated. Beautiful swimming spot and shade

name: Public cold shower
description: Single cold shower on beach front next to Beach Bar. Open during summer season.

name: Camping Urbasa
description:
Large campsite with facilities, bar, restaurant and some good hiking. 

There is WiFi at the bar which is not very good and no 3G reception anywhere nearby.

Lots of play equipment for children and horses for them to feed. (Don’t park near the horses unless you want to be surrounded by children all day!)

name: Mistral Beach Bar
description: Amazing Beach Bar selling Tapas, salads, burgers, Dutch snacks and drinks!

name: Betelu - Swimming Hole
description: River to swim. Has a slide, toilet facility and parking

name: Monte Cabo
description: Small camping area with sea view. The owner is from The Netherlands and speaks english, german and spanish... the bathroom is new and very clean. 10 min walk to the next beach. a good spot to watch dolphins.

name: Nice Spot in the "Picos de Europa"
description:
Nice Spot inside the wonderful national natural park "Picos de Europa"

The place is situated just at the beggining of the most famous hiking route of that park. 

No Amenities, just camp.

name: Nice Spot in Gijon
description:
Nice Spot to visit de city of Gijón. Always there are a lot of vans  here

Walking to the city center 20-30 minutes, but with a wonderful views of the sea.

There is a public bathroom in the parking site. In 100 meters you can find a beach that allows dogs. At morning a local baker offers bread and some  things to breakfast

Spanish:
Un buen lugar para pernoctar y conocer la ciudad de Gijón. Siempre está lleno de furgonetas y autocaravanas.

20 o 30 minutos caminando hasta el centro de Gijón por el paseo marítimo. Hay un baño público en el mismo parking y una playa que acepta perros a 100 metros.

Por la mañana pasa un panadero que ofrece pan y bollos para desayunar.

name: Bornos deportiva
description: Parking at the end of the harbor with platform and lake access for swimming

name: Parc Landako
description:
A small car park at the edge of a large reservoir just a few kilometers north of Vitoria-Gasteiz. Busy during the day in summer but mostly quiet at night. Sanitary facilities nearby. Good stop for one night on the road.
---
Un petit parking au bord d'un grand lac de retenue à quelques kilomètres au nord de Vitoria-Gasteiz. Du monde en journée en été mais assez calme la nuit. Sanitaires à proximité. Bonne étape d'une nuit sur la route.

name: Parking Chartreuse Santa Maria de  Miraflores
description:
Parking of the site of the Charterhouse of Miraflores near Burgos. Very calm except the sound of the bells. No services.
---
Parking du site de la chartreuse de Miraflores près de Burgos. Très calme hormis le son des cloches. Pas de services.

name: Aera de recreativa de plaia de Tagle
description:
Parking en forte pente face à l'océan. Petit restaurant en journée. Pas de services.

Parking in steep slope facing the ocean. Small restaurant during the day. No services.

name: Camping Barcelona
description: Great campsite, clean and well maintained facilities. Friendly bilingual staff at reception. Free shuttle to next town - Mantaro (where you can get train to Barcelona) and also shuttle bus on offer direct to Barcelona centre for £2.90. Shaded spots with trees. There’s also an animal petting zoo with some farm animals, swimming pool, restaurant and supermarket onsite.

name: "Official" Parking Spot in Leon
description:
This is a official parking spot in the norhtern city of León.

There is a shopping center at 50 meters. The city center is 20min walking. 
There is also a water fountain in the parking. It's free for 48hours.

Este es un parking oficial en la ciudad del norte de España de León.
Hay un centro comercial a 50 metros de distancia. El centro se encuentra a 20 miutos caminando.

También hay una fuente de agua en el mismo parking. Es gratis las primeras 48 horas.

name: Playa de la Puntilla
description: Large dirt parking lot next to great beach. Toilets open until 7.45pm, public cold beach showers. Patrolling police said 'no problem'.

name: Embalse de Yesa
description:
Flat surface under trees above the high-water mark of the reservoir. The track continues to the shore where there are additional spots for parking when the water level is low.

Camping/parking to sleep appears to be generally accepted near the lake.

name: Abandoned Spa and Nive Via Ferrata
description:
Nice and quiet spot in front of a old abandoned spa. It's ideal to meet the nothern of Burgos, where there are a lot of waterfalls.
 
Five minutes walking you have a wonderful via ferrata. Link about that point and the surroundings, in the place website, (Spanish, but you have a video too)

Tranquilo lugar de pernocta en frente del balneario abandonado de Sobrón. A cinco minutos tienes una buena vía ferrata. 

Perfecto para conocer el norte de burgos y sus fantasticas cascadas (link en la web del lugar)

name: El Meson Camping
description: Small family run camp near small village, grassy shady areas, immaculately clean, just delightful for an overnight stop.

name: Camping Buganvilla
description:
Nice campingground, 10.min walk to the beach   
Bus to Marbella. 5.km
17.-€ with Asci card.

name: Camping Bosque de Gordón SL
description: A beautiful big site with many spots for caravans and tents only alike. Surrounded by mountains, the views are amazing. It's closed for the main season already, but there is might still be scope to stay here, if you can get hold of the owner. It's an older couple, they don't speak English but are super lovely. All facilities available.

name: Speed Box Mechanic 4x4
description: An excellent mechanical 4x4. The owner is very friendly and helpful. They did a repair in our defend 110 before going to Morocco. The service was done quickly and the price is very fair. Highly recomended! You can also rent a space and fix the car yourself.

name: Parking lot camping
description:
Off season parking lot camping next to the beach. Low season parking lot camping, free, public toilets, very close to the beach. 
I’m guessing this is not possible during high season, too busy, to much traffic. But September/October/November is slow in this area, and the weather is beautiful.
Lots of restaurants, some closed for the season, grocery store near by.

name: Labyrinth Park of Horta
description: Massive Park and labyrinth from the 1700’s very old and very cool. Cost about $3.00 for entrance, worth it.

name: Orio-Igeldo Park
description: Nice picknick area over the sea, grill places, tables, toilets. Parking overnight no problem, directly near the small road, not much traffic.

name: Embalse de Negratin
description: Secluded spot right on the shore of the reservoir. Very quiet and peaceful. Perfect for swimming.

name: Puerto de Bonansa
description: Excellent view into the mountains. Just watch the pic. In addition you will find a very nice enduro circular track. Ride it either by bicycle, bike or 4x4.

name: medinaceli
description: camper area on a big parking lot on the side of an old village with roman ruins. altitude 1200m. free

name: Girona
description: a big parking reserved for camper. no electricity. water. free of charge. forest and running place around. ok for any kind of rig. near from the motorway. limited to 72 hours.

name: El Noguer
description: Big field on owners land, loads of space (we came in mid August and still loads of room). €10 for a 24h pitch with water, waste (grey and chem), toilets, WiFi (actually quite decent too) and electricity all included! Owners were lovely. Pet friendly. Nothing fancy but a great stop over! Would recommend and stay again!

name: Castillo de Garcimunoz
description:
Free Campervan stop over in castle car park! 
Sign posted 72 hours max. Water and waste facilities all free. Great stop over right at the foot of a castle! Also great vantage point for amazing sunset and sunrise! 👌

name: Rugby club parking Salamanca
description: Tolerated parking by a bridge near Salamanca centre. Quiet at night, loads of campers around so definitely a tolerated parking area. No amenities but only a 15 walk to the centre so who cares! Felt very safe at all times

name: fuentesdetodos
description: goya village. it is a parking entering the village. kinder playground. swimming pool in summer only. no services. free

name: Big area near road CM403
description: Big flat area, partly shady, nice view, cold in the nights (900 m)

name: bembribre
description: parking of closed restaurant on river boardside under trees. very quite. no services.free

name: Chipiona, direct at the beach
description: Nice parking lot direct at the sandy beach. Restaurants and bar open in high season.

name: Camping Pico de la Miel
description: Big Campground, close Autovia from North to Madrid. All the year open, uncounted lots.

name: Embalse de Bubal
description: Nice spot just down below the road next to the reservoir. Flat ground and few already made fire pits. Nice view of the mountains and the road above is very quiet

name: Parking area San Fernando
description: Quiet and nice place next to the lake. Dustbin. In the evening couplescome to watch the sunset.

name: Motorhome àrea in Viladrau
description: Peaceful place with power, water, in Nivell village with all services. Excursions possible walking and biking

name: Camping Le Viorna  Potes Picos de Europa
description: Lovely “ Alpine “ looking site at the base of an amazing mountain area , good helpful staff ,good restaurant, but closed 1st Nov for the winter !

name: Alhambra Caravanas parking
description: car park designated for motorhomes near to Alhambra. overnight stays allowed. no facilities.

name: El Greco, Toledo
description:
fully equipped, commercial campground,
walking distance (3km) to the historic town of Toledo

name: Parking lot
description: It is a parking lot in a small village about ten km from the Seasiders. No facilities, but very calm in the night

name: Rioja Alta Golf Club
description: It is a parking lot before the Golf club. The caminando de Santiago de Compostela is Passing by. We had a quiet night here. The restaurant offers good food, beer and wine

name: Bodegas David Moreno
description: We stayed over night after tasting Viños de Rioja. Very friendly owner. We could use the services.

name: Caravan zones in Calatayud
description:
Free city parking with dump station and fresh water, quiet possibility to stay overnight
---
Kostenfreier Parkplatz der Stadt mit Dump Station und Frischwasser, ruhige Möglichkeit zu übernachten

name: playa el playazo
description: Public parking lot on the beach. No facilities available. Restaurants next door.

name: En frente del yacimiento de Ullastret
description:
Esta ubicación es el parking del yacimiento arqueológico de Ullastret. Hay baño si el yacimiento está abierto (entrando a visitar las ruinas). Parking tranquilo y gratuito. Cuenta con una fuente para recargar agua

This is the official parking of the ruins of Ullastret. There is a bathroom inside the building if is open.. Free parking and quiet. There is a fountain in the parking

name: La Tierra Verde
description: Parking for motor homes on the farm. Holiday accommodation. beautiful surroundings, stunning views. very quiet, 5min from A66 Caceres-Mérida

name: Dentro de los Monegros
description:
This overnight place is inside the Los Monegros desert, in front of the hermitage of San Miguel.

Perfect to know the area and the routes Juberres. There is no  services, but you will sleep very calm and with an incredible sky.

name: La Tintorera (Laundromat)
description:
Laundromat. 
Laundry: 19kg (6€), 15kg (4€)
Drier machine: 19kg (3€)

name: Wine Shop (Bodegas Utielanas)
description: Perfect wine shop to taste and buy local wine, specially bobal red wines.

name: Puerto Gelves
description:
small parking / camping area on a breakwater in the harbor.
Fee: 15 per day

name: Las Dunas Trafalgar
description:
parking slot of the 
“Las Dunas“ restaurant
few parkings for RV's. might be crowded during high season.

name: picnic place
description:
picnic area,
cold water, quite, nice walk area

name: Chellanatura
description: Hill top camp site in an olive grove. Clean facilities, washing machine. Owners are Dutch/ Belgium. Quiet site.

name: Parking Area
description:
Parking Area, sandy ground, dirty ground,
you can only enter by drive over the kerb, between the trees, but it's possible also for higher and bigger rigs.
Metro Station is only 200m far away and the supermarket as well, 
there also a small park with a playground for kids. opposite of the playground, near the bicycle station is a water tap located (portable water),

name: water tap in a park
description: water tap for portable water, just to fill up canisters or bottles

name: La Azohia
description: Overnight stop at the far end of the small town, beach side. Would be very busy in summer. Quiet in November!

name: Finca Caravana
description:
Campground in the middle of almond and olives plantations with a very nice view on the mountains around.
The owner Franz (german) is very friendly and helpful.
it is a meeting place for travellers to Africa and a place for relaxing as well.
Does not have own water source, but not far away is a spring with portable water

name: Fuente del Pinar - Spring
description:
small spring with potable water,
to fill up canisters ok

name: Tulip Inn, Zaragoza
description:
Great value - we were impressed! Big rooms, clean, modern, like a 4-star.  52 euros, or 78 with full breakfast for 2. Good wifi, great shower.   

3 course dinner is 12 euros pp, and includes beer, wine, soda, etc.  

For business travelers and truckers 

https://tulip-inn-zaragoza.goldentulip.com/en-us/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=maps&utm_content=ESP46498&utm_campaign=GoldenTulip&arrival=2018-11-15T00:00:00&departure=2018-11-16T00:00:00&rooms[0][adult]=1&rooms[0][child]=0&location=

name: Edificio Kilimanjaro
description: It has a flat place for parking with no wind. You can ask for shower, WiFi and kitchen. Beautiful views and very good vibes with the owner. You may ask how much it costs because it depends on wether the owner is available or not.

name: El Toyo
description:
behind (right hand side) the big parking area is a dirt road, on the end is a area for parking, near the small fort,
showers are on the beach, trash bins in the park

name: Picnic Area
description:
Very nice and quiet picnic area with tables, trash bins and portable water, nice view to the mountains, nearby is an official campground, 
quiet at night,

(mobile connection is very bad)

name: parking area on the beach
description:
small parking area near the beach, showers and public Toilets (closed in off season) on the beach, restaurant with WiFi (not free of charge),
trash bins

name: Roadside Scenic Viewpoint
description: This is a large level pull-off along side a narrow, hilly, winding gravel road with a solid surface despite the rain. We drove in 4WD to get there, but the other vehicles on the road were 2WD. The parking area is perched on top of a small plateau with shallow valleys surrounding it and mountains beyond the valleys. Very peaceful day and night.

name: View to Ronda
description:
Area between olive trees and near the view point over Ronda, some flat places at this area, nice and quite, not so much shadow, there is a water tap with potable water located
(4G with simyo)

name: water tap
description: water tap with push button, portable water

name: P+R Parking on Metrostation
description:
huge parking area next to the Metro station. there are 11 Stations in between to the city centre. ticket price = 1,90 Euro/person and ride.
Supermarket nearby. some traffic noises of course but still ok at night. nobody bother us.
you will see a traffic sign on the main street (P+R + Metro) and there is also a sign not for vehicles over 3m. but there is no bridge or barrier on the way. so don't be afraid. you can enter this area from both sides. it's clean and looks very safe.

name: La Junquera
description: Car Park commercial centre toilets open from 8 am to 11 PM

name: Poblet monastery
description: Parking monetary with toilets available between 8am and 7pm

name: Massanasss a 10 km de Valence
description:
Tacoval (www.tacoval.com) electronic specialist and Webasto-heating
competent and helpful
specialist of Electronic

name: Ibi Camper Parking
description:
Town area for camper with water bus n°6 to downtown

emplacement municipal pour CC avec un point d'eau bus n° 6 pour le centre

name: Totana/Lorca
description:
better with 4x4 on a gravel field in the middle of nature, it smells of wild bushes and wild rabbits
---
mieux vaut un 4x4 dans un champ Inculte au milieu de la nature et ses odeurs de thym et des lapins de garenne

name: Puerto Deportivo
description: Camper parking on the far side of a marina. It's pretty tight, but we did see a class A motorhome there. Very close to the 140 bus stop into Seville.

name: En la naturaleza | In the nature "Ruta de los pueblos blancos"
description: Good Place to stay and overnight. In the white villages road trip.There was another campers the night we stay there. No services. Very Beautiful

name: Vitoria Train Station (no luggage storage)
description:
I just wanted to let other travelers know that there is no place to guard bags here, at the train station (such as lockers).  The train station is closest to the Parlamento tram stop.  

The bus station (which is across town, but with a short walk you can jump on the tram to get there) does have storage for luggage & is a pretty interesting building design, too.  The closest tram stop to the bus station is called Intermodal.  

The tram cost 1.45 Euro for one ticket.

name: Artium Museum
description: 5 Euro entry fee / less for students.  Worth a visit depending on what exhibits they currently are showing.  They will also guard luggage for you.

name: Nueva Andalucia next to a lake
description: Very quiet and nice level parking in a posh residential area. Small lake, lots of tables and trails for hikes in the hills.

name: Cala Reona
description: Nice parking place direct behind the beach, big enough for trucks. Very quiet out of summer season!! Trekking possible along the coastline.

name: Road Side Pullout
description:
Nice spot to stay for one night, small pullout on the side of a secondary road, the lake is just by the spot.
Very quiet and there are some trails around.

name: Eco Camping
description: Nice, clean, great views of the valley and mountains. About 9km from the center of  town. Easy walk to the Sanctuary of Mercy where you can visit the "Ecco Homo" painting.  About 6€ per vehicle and 3€ per person. Laundry, pool, quiet.

name: almogia
description: large level area next to barragem,plenty of space and fire pits.quiet and no light pollution.weak phone signal.

name: Caso Paco
description: Great food especially calamari. Great views of the Sierra Nevada and Granada from roof top terrace. Dogs welcome on a lead. A little expensive but service was good ( 9.20 euros for calamares starter but good portion size)

name: Ermita de San Zoilo
description: Old church. Tables for eating and bbq. Water. Wild camping under your respondability, not allowed.

name: Melilla Harbour
description:
front office a parking free 72 h toilets 6 am to 12 pm
face au guichet d'embarquement un parking gratuit 72 h toilettes hall 6 a24 h
idéal pour prendre embarquement

name: Almeria
description:
good for one night area like car Park near Lidl free no service
--
parking non aménagé a côté de Lidl bien pour une nuit gratuit

name: view On El Chorro
description: perfect campground with majestic view on el Chorro lakes ear Campillos. 2 magnific point of views near the tent

name: Elche
description:
10 km from Elch After industrial pool front cemetery neighbour quiet water inside cemetery
10 km d'Elche après Z.I devant un cimetière eau potable interieur

name: Tordera
description:
parking of sports areas 5 mn down  town quiet drain spot other side road
parking des terrains de sports 5 mn a pied du centre vidange de l'autre côté de la route

name: ALKORA
description: Insurance company, to buy international green card to non European cars, motorcycles...

name: El Piño, Torrox Park, Malaga
description: Nice site. Compact. Good facilities. All amenities close. Good services on site

name: Camping Malaga Monte Parc
description: Nice friendly campsite with bar, shop and food onsite. Handy for visiting Autocaravanners Hidalgo Malaga workshop. Mostly English people here

name: Camping Malaga Monte Parc
description: Nice quiet campsite/camping. In the countryside of Alaurin El Grande, Malaga region. Easy to find on Google Maps. There is a bar/coffee shop and a shop onsite.

name: Camping Torre del Mar
description: A great site about 100 metres from the beach. they do good winter / long term rates. Restaurant on site. Piping hot water in showers with good pressure. Shops , bars and restaurants are a few minutes walk away. Dogs allowed and a field next door to walk them. There is WiFi onsite, but I have not used it as have my own.

name: El Piño
description: nice site in TORROX, above the coast. All amenities

name: Free parking in Cordoba near historical site
description:
A large free car park in Cordoba next to what seems to be a construction site- it is marked on google as free parking but doesn’t always come up. 
There are no amenities but as parking in Cordoba seems to be a bit of a hassle I would say it’s pretty good and quiet for a night or too!

name: riverside near merida
description:
well established track running along large river about 6kms from Merida. lots of spots to park up, lots of shade, nice hikes or biking along river.
few hundred metres from road, very quiet spot no houses around.
Good spot.

name: Enoteca Pepe Blasco (Wine Shop)
description:
Wine shop for tasting and buying local wine (D.O. Utiel-Requena). 
Opening hours: 
Thursday to Saturday from 19:00 to 22:00.

name: Carnicería Isidora (Butchery)
description:
Well situated butchery. One of the multiple options in Utiel for buying local sausages: «embutido». “Chorizo, longaniza, morcilla, güeña”. Fresh or vacuumed. 
Opening hours:
Monday to Saturday from 9:00 to 14:30 and 17:00 to 21:00.

name: salinas
description: Very nice place to stay. Very quiet, only the sea is heard.

name: Alberg Pere Tarrés Barcelona
description:
NIce hostel . 
17€ shared room 
8,27€ parking for my motorbike  ( private parking , very safe )

name: Lemon Garden HOSTEL
description:
Nice hostel 
private parking for 1 or maybe more motorcycles 
shared room 12€ 
breakfast 2.50€
have kitchen and shower .toilette

name: Fisterra, Galicia
description: Wild camping near beach. There is a fresh water tap available. Easy access for vans.

name:
Área de autocaravanas
Parking Alange

Alange / Extremadura
description: Car park and waste disposal services for campervans and roof tent cars. Free parking for 2 days. free drinking water and toilets (toilets long drop and no paper). best bit is that it is next to a beautiful dam and stunning sunsets and sunrise. good fishing. tiny town and noone bothers you. next to a small football pitch with two storks nests on stadium lights and you can watch the storks feed their young. orange trees growing on the road. very quiet when we were there in March.

name: Askarruntz free camper place
description:
Free parking spots for camper vans etc.
There are no toilets, but when you go to the bar/pizzeria you can use it there.
There are disposals for your dirty water and toilet.
The area is beautifull, but no sun in the morning or late afternoon, because of the hills that surround you.
Bar/restaurant is 30 meters away.

name: Camping La Pesquera
description:
nice camping .
with WiFi in the reception .. and one bar for drink a some beer ! front from the river .

name: parking municipal
description: Municipal parking lot. There were a few other campers there at the time. A friendly police officer showed us the spot.

name: Càmping Aigües Braves
description:
Wild-camping feeling, large open places, right by a river, small bar included, order rolls for breakfast, small pool with chairs, small houses to rent, very quiet
We do not use electricity and kitchen. So I am not sure, same with WiFi

name: Fonte Diaz, Santiago de Compostela
description: Service area with parking for 5 units. Next to a park and children’s nursery so busy during day but very quiet at night. Village nearby has supermarket and bars etc. Close to airport and just 25 minutes from Santiago.

name: San Martin de Ordoves
description: Lost in the wild. Grassland near the Roman church 11 C Mozarabista.

name: Anibal Servicio Fuel GLP San Dump
description: The Anibal gasstation and camper services: overnight spot 7€, shower 2€, washing machine 4€, dryer 4€, sani dump and fresh water intake 2€, internet 1€, diesel, gasoline, high pressure car cleaning and GLP (also fill bottles).

name: Embalsa San Clemente Free Camp
description: Quite a few places to find at the lake. This peticulair spot is reachable by good quality unpaved track, no need for 4wd or clearance. Along the bitumen road that is leading over de dam you find a few paved parkings. Easy access for all rigs there. Very quiet.

name: Albergue La Credencial
description:
very nice place for stay few day in Stgo de Compostela . have parking outside front of the hostel . I think safe .. I don't had problem with my motorbike .
12€ shared room

name: Algodonales free campsite
description: Free campsite owned by Algodonales municipality. Water and electricity for free. restrooms were closed during our stay. No need for registration, nice to visit the pueblos blancos.

name: Peñas de Aya
description: Small parking lot, good views and quiet. No facilities. Big vehicles can park here but will have to go up a steep, narrow, winding road

name: Gran Camping Avenida
description:
Camping Gran Avenida is a holiday complex for the whole family in Benicasim. We offer bungalows and accommodation for caravans and tents.

We are a family business oriented to make you spend the best holidays in a close environment. Enjoy a privileged climate, our natural landscapes and a wide variety of beach and mountain activities. The main objective of our team is to make you enjoy your holidays trying that you have a pleasant stay and that you feel like at home.

Meet people, do the activities you like the most, discover new places and discover wonderful corners in the Mediterranean. Enjoy your holidays at Camping Gran Avenida and we'll make sure you want to repeat them.
