name: Bonanza Laundromat
description: Located at 795 Ignacio Sottomaier. Left laundry at 9:00 and got it back at 6:00 same day. VERY EXPENSIVE – Most we’ve paid in South America. 115 Br R      ($30 U.S.) for about two loads. She charges by the kilo. I think it was 11.50 R/Kilo. I think her hours are 9 – 6 Mon. – Fri.

name: Deba Beach parking lot
description: Free car park on beach front, quiet with with some other campers. 3.6m height restriction but no parking spots larger than standard size. Public toilets open from 10am, shower on beach, restaurant next door and supermarkets in the town (5-10min walk).  Near a train track but not very disturbing.

name: HOSTEL DE LAS FACULTADES
description:
nice hostel !! the owner is great ! bicycle  traveler around Europe !!!  
17€ with breakfast ( shared room ) 
Parking in the front ( free ) and safe .. 
kitchen and fridge !

name: Castillo de butron car park
description: car park 2min walk from the castle of butron. no facilities, quiet

name: Along the D50, follow sign calle de mise à l'eau pogains
description: Very quit place next to lac du temple in nature réserve Forêt d'orient. Maybe many people when the fishing season opens 21/4. You need blocks!

name: Lakeside Camping
description: free. picnic benches. hiking trails. quiet. cafe nearby but the manager is an pain who doesn't like pets.  cafe only open on weekends in winter.

name: embalse view
description: free. clean.  2 midsize RVs here and relatively flat. might be packed in high season. great views and restaurants nearby.

name: Bajada a La Playa Free Camp
description: Quiet grassy spot close to the little bay. The roughly shaped hillside provides some windshade. Entrance road from Santillán is paved but quite narrow. Not really steep.

name: Oasis al mar   vera
description:
established campsite  only open November until 1 may.    no showers or toilets  good pitches level very clean  owner very welcoming.   electric  3€  10€ per night include  WiFi.
 washing mashing and waste dump also available  fresh water fill
 plenty of open space for dog run outside camping area

name: Restaurant Cal Quico
description:
Excellent Restaurant with a big Parking. 
Opens @ 1PM for luch. 
Lunch menu (lot of choice) was 12.5€ for 2 plates ;-)

name: Aire de Camping Tapia
description: Black-/Greywater Dumpstation and fresh water too; 4€ per day. Overlooking the ocean, nice place to stay

name: Car park, 500m from Monachil Cohorrus hike
description: free car park, no facilities, a little dirty. other campers around

name: Castile la duque
description: Open beach down a track through houses. Beach cafe with lovely couple running it.   Police not interested in camper vans at this time of the year.  Short  walk into lots of bars.

name: camino del cabo
description: large car park and off road parking near a beach   busy today but it is a national bank holiday in Spain  lots of campervans/motorhome  and paragliding

name: La Mariposa
description:
Lovely place. Tapas with drinks -they where delicious. The people who run and serve are extremely kind and generous. At the bar they speak Spanish, English, Italian and a little of everything else.

Sang my daughter happy birthday (as the first time we went in it was her) and it made the night.

name: Car Park
description: Free car park near hike starting points. Car park with a small river alongside it. Has toilets during week days, water taps supposedly along some hike routes but we did not see any working ones. Has large rubbish bins. Restaurants in town (5min). Tent camping is possible

name: Street parking along beach
description:
Limited street parking near beach, would be busy during peak season.
Free toilets, beach showers, potable water. Free wifi if you sign up at cultural centre. Restaurants and shopping centre close by.

name: Isla Cristina
description: Niveau set up. Dumping and portable water. For €5 you can use dumping and water. €10 if you stay the night. They have a little beach with lounge chairs. No shade. View over marches.. clean. Register at reception.

name: Moia
description:
beautiful place 1 km from the town with incredible views and wonderful sunset. calm and peaceful


precioso lugar a 1 km del pueblo con increíbles vistas y maravillosa puesta de sol. tranquilo y apacible

name: San Lucar de Guadiana
description: Dumping, water, cassette dumping. Parking close to small town right on the border with Portugal. Couple of bars and restaurants in town.. cute and quiet

name: Picnic area along delta river
description:
Small picnic area, could fit 3-5 campers, slightly uneven ground.
Has potable water tap, barbeque area, bins and (dirty) toilet area. 
Locals use area for cycling and barbeques in the daytime, but otherwise quite peaceful despite being close to highway.
10min walk to the town which has all you need.

name: Potable water tap in picnic area
description: located near the cooking area, potable water

name: Cabo Fisterra
description: On the right side before the parking of the capo begins, there s nice parking space with a great sea view. Two different Levels, so lots of space for vans. Quiet. No facilities but at the souvenir shops at the capo look out are toilets (200m).

name: Ronda
description: This spot is very quiet and hidden from the road. A lot of shade if it gets too hot. The viewpoint to Ronda is just a few meters away. Water tap nearby (in the corner of the road from where you turn down to this spot). No other facilities.

name: Dehesa de abajo
description: Place on top of a hill. Mixed parking. Bird watching close to Doñana National Park wake up next to the nesting storks. Very quiet at night. Good restaurant and WiFi

name: Tranco
description: Beautifull spot on higher ground with great view on the lake. Spot next to the street but no traffic at night and almost none in daytime. Maybe not allowed to stay here in high season.

name: Embalse de guadalmena
description: Nice place a little higher than the lake but with easy access to the water for swim or kayak. Flat place on gravel. Place for 10 campes. May be more people in summer. We were here alone. Very quiet only sounds of nature. Easy access also for none 4x4.

name: Loriguila dam
description: Flat gravel spots on top of dam left and right. Also one flat spot close to the water. Very quiet day and night. Cool swimming in the lake or perfect for a hike to Chulilla and swim there in the canyon.

name: Scenic Wild Camp
description: Follow jeep trail east of intersection, along north side of property wall. After about 100 meters, turn onto Left trail which goes down a bit, then rises up along a small cliff over lake. No facilities, but good cellular reception.

name: Área De Autocaravanas De Cazorla
description:
scenic place overlooking a huge valley of olive trees. stunning sunsets and great hiking. place has gray and black disposal and fresh water.

pitches more or less level. don't miss the lower deck.

name: Embalse Regajo
description: Lakeside spot on green grass. Just at the same level of the water. Close to the A23 but very quiet. Easy access. Ideal for a swim, fishing, kayak...  recommended

name: Irrisarri hostel
description: nice hostel up in the mountains. they have a nice website with all the info needed. paid €14 for a 10 beds dorm. parking but no shared kitchen (available for 4 euros). they may be closed on weekends for some reasons. better check or reserve online beforehand.

name: All Iron Hostel
description:
nice, clean and spacious hostel with a little cul de sac right in front of the entrance where you can park your bike or car. kitchen has very little tools and just one electric stove but it s sufficient.
€18 with breakfast. fast wifi and easy access to the city, but just outside enough not to be in the bad neighborhood. it s Spain so, lock your things up! big lockers in dorms but only one power plug which is conveniently located inside the locker. beautiful view from the 10 beds dorm.

name: Sant Cugat de Gavadons
description: beautiful place for sleep. Is little, Max. 4 vans. is perfect for sleep in tent. 2,6 kms of the principal road. next to Collsuspina.

name: East side of lake - relaxing and beautiful
description: We came for a night, and stayed a few. Small path 100 meter past picnic tables.  Away from the west side traffic/road noise and with beautiful sunsets and sounds of the lake and birds.  First night we were alone, the second 2 vans joined. Nice walking trails. There is a small bar about 500 meters further with friendly people and toilet. Good cell coverage.

name: Hiking Paradise Sierra de Grazalema
description: This spot is in the middle of Sierra the Grazalema. It is a nice big parking lot surrounded by trees. From here the hike El Pinsapar starts (you need permission for the hike drom the tourist office in Grazalema or El Bosque). About 2km from Grazalema. Very quiet at night. No facilities.

name: Camper Shop Hildago
description: This is a Caravan Center with a small camper shop. We found everything we needed (new water pump, sealing for our toilet, some spare parts). Close to Seville.

name: Next to Park
description: Nice place next to river with some shade.  Toilet about 200m in park.

name: Bar Crescente
description: what a place. underrated and definitely a surprise looking at it from the outside. the host was accommodating and the stay was pleasant. the facilities were all new and INCREDIBLY CLEAN. i parked the bike under a little veranda next to the hotel. perfect quiet night and delicious breakfast made with local produce. €15 for a single room with shared bath. it s on booking.com too

name: Estrella do Mar
description: very nice and clean hostel. brand new facility. small but cozy with a beautiful patio to park your bike in securely at night. steps from the beach and the fortress. €15 a night in a mixed dorm. landry facilities and outside sink and clothing lines to dry your stuff up. iago is a great host.

name: mequinenza
description: a beautiful and quiet space on the waterfront. we where there all day with our rooftop camper, swim in the water, cooked a meal, enjoyed the view. didnt know if it was allowed but saw nobody all day.

name: Fuente parque centro
description:
Accessible drinking water source during park opening hours (or entering through the broken holes in the fences).
---
Fuente de agua potable accesible en horario de apertura del parque (o entrando por los huecos rotos de las vallas).

name: Camping Fresneda
description: Camp site with lots of trees. Facilities are clean and the staff is friendly. There is a swimming pool, but it was not open yet. There are washing machines for self service and you can order fresh bred for the next day. Free WiFi at the bar.

name: Hostal Trigueros
description: Beautiful old Building, clean and new - nice bedrooms. 20,- / night breakfast included. Motorcycle stays save in closed garage around the corner 1,-€/night :-)   Perfect!

name: Finca Los Juncales
description: Small farm with shower and cooking facilities, free for any adventure bikers with tents. Also 2 bedrooms available, hot water shower, bathrooms and BBQs. Workshop for urgent repairs and under roof parking. Only available until the 30th May 2019.

name: Hostel el Mercader de Sedas
description: basic hostel but it has public motorcycle parking nearby. the area seems secure but the hostel is slightly ran down. overall it was a great deal for me at €10 a night in a shared dorm with ensuite. there s a tiny kitchen at the top floor you can use. wifi is present only in the bottom shared area and not in rooms.

name: The River Hostel
description: great hostel with big rooms, kitchen, bar, and clean facilities. motorcycle parking right outside so, hell yeah! breakfast available for 3 euros in the am. strong wifi and steps from the city center and the beautiful park along the river. cheap price if you book in advance. paid €14 in 6 beds dorm

name: Mas el Mir
description: Fabulous retreat if you want to stay in the heart of Catalunya and unwind. it s an original 1350 house, refurbished and remodelled recently. beautiful rooms, pool and fantastic fresh local food. the host, Eva, is a keen motorcycle rider and traveller, so the place is obviously friendly in that sense. there are 5 rooms and one apartment to rent. The best place i'be been so far to relax and take a break from the road. The place is listed on booking.com but it has its own website and virtual tour online, as well. well worth the price.

name: Camp and Hotel El Cortijo
description:
Camping grounds behind hotel and restaurant, gated, with nice pool included, with lot of trees and shadow.
I stayed 1 night, paid 12 EUR for 1 person/tent/motorcycle. Shower in the hotel room, restrooms in the restaurant. I guess they have another premises by the pool...in summer when the season is in full swing.

name: View on El Teide
description: 100m into a sideway, just my Motocycle and my hammock. Beautyfull view. Came bevore sunset, left shortly after sunrise. No lager vehicles - I don't know if they could turn.

name: zona acampada controlada
description: In the nature park are a few designated free camping areas, there is water, cold showers and toilets (which were closed when we were here), tables and BBQ places. Very quiet in the woods.

name: Hidden rivercamp
description: Flat meadow next to the river. Enough space for big rigs. Hidden from the road, easy entry to the clear water

name: overnight spot old road
description: Next to the new road is a bit left over old road or a used to be parking lot. We pitched the tent way back behind bushes and trees and had a calm night. Also useful with a camping car I guess.

name: Alicante
description: Big dirt parking place directly at a sandy beach. Nice view of Alicante. Yes, some Airplane noise, but it is okay. It says, there is a 3500 kg limit, but there was also a big lorry/truck parked there. So Big Rig should be okay.

name: Near Parking P1
description: Dumpstation with unknown water near busparkinglot P1.

name: Montserrat Busparkinglot P1
description:
After the last bus and train have left it is absolutely quiet. Police patrols at night. Toilets in the train station can only be used during operating hours. Free parking.
You could also park further up the hill at P2, but very few places are level and if you want to stay overnight you will be charged for another day. If you have twin-tires or double-axle you will be charged as a bus.

name: Centelles
description:
Gravel Motorhome parking space.
Pro: Free parking, free dumping, free water, free electricity.
Con: Traffic noise is quite loud.

name: Free parking at Santillana Del Mar
description: Free parking at the edge of the town in the field. 10 min to the historic town centre

name: Large dirt carpark with lots of tree shelter
description:
Huge carpark under some old pine trees right across the train lines from a main beach. Shaded areas & nice patches of sun. Train line is a tad normal but spot is very beautiful. Shame that there is so much litter. Still worth a stop! 
Be careful of all the pot holes on the way in!

name: Ruta del Cares
description: Overnight spot a few meters before Cain. This spot has no amenities but one can spend the night here and hike from here the famous Routa del Cares.

name: Mountain View on Smugglers Road
description: Beautiful spot with mountain view above 2'000 m. Right beside the Smugglers Trail  on the way to Andorra. Andorra is just over the hill. No facilities, amazing view, lots of horses, no reception, perfect to stay here for a night or two.

name: Santa Antonio   In national park.
description:
Valhalla, Nirvana!  A spectacular place! On top of a small mountain just north of the town of Javea. About an hour south of Valencia. Hard to believe someone else hasn’t already tagged this location. The view is just incredible! 

Ok, down to details. From Javea take the road (cv736) up to the national park. The road is not big rig friendly (5 ton and over). Several hairpin turns and narrow. Ideal for Westphalia and Jumper style and size. I came up from the south. Saw a large plastic Fiat camper. Maybe came up from the north. Entrance will be from the east side of the main road and roughly 2- 2.5 km to park. No official entrance. Keep your eyes open for parking on your left with roughly 22 parking spots separated by wood poles. Private residence beside  parking lot. Please be courteous! Off the parking lot is bike and hiking trails. Picnic area is tiered with lots of picnic tables in good condition. Stone fences in semi circular arches round out this wonderful scene of the Mediterranean. Although there is a sign saying water is available, I found the water taps capped off. No water for some time. 

No amenities here at all. You should be fully self contained, or prepare to drive into town and back. At the end of the road is a beautiful lighthouse on the edge of the promontory. About 1 km from parking lot. Unknown at this time if operational. WiFi is sketchy. Parking lot is gravel. Please be environmentally friendly and stick to the trails and avoid walking on flora and fauna.

So, from here I’ll let the pictures do the talking!

name: Merman’s
description: Original road that was left as a pullout to view the sea. Room for 5-6 campers but only one spot that is level. Pavement/ gravel. In residential area to the north. Drop off to the sea within a few meters of parking. No amenities whatsoever. This is my second time here. Great place to overnight. Some traffic noise but quiet after 23:00.

name: Camping Castillo de Loarre
description:
Great campsite with faclities and good restarant. Set beneath the medieval Castle of Loare and stunning views over the plains. 
Located within 1/2 a mile of the nearest camino rural and a huge selection of trails to drive.

name: West of town of Barbate
description:
Conservation area parking lot. On the A-2233 west of the town of Barbate, 2-3 km out of town. Barbate has fuel, restaurants and shopping centers. There are no amenities at the parking area. A gravel lot leads to many hiking trails that go down to the beach. There is room for a few big rigs but, watch for low tree branches. Parking can be in the open or under shade of trees. 
This is my third time here. Police come in once or twice a day to do checks. No problem. Quiet at night. Beautiful view of ocean and beaches. Leftover defensive bunkers from the 1940’s among a rabbits warren of trails.

name: Camping Playa Penerronda
description: Verry Nice  Clean and Small Camping Ground  close the sea

name: Cliffs on cobaron
description:
It is a beautiful spot in the nature near a cliff! Awesome view.
Sharing with other campers.
The Jakob’s pilgrim way crosses.
There’s water but no toilet, showers
Just nature ;)

name: Tagle - Park Ermita santa Justa
description: Flat parking for 3 or 4 Campers. No services. Great views. Wind exposed

name: Orduña - Nacimiento Nervion Fuente Santiago
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals. 

Parking in protected and picnic area in the middle of an old beech forest . Great views at 15m walking. Waterfall 222m . Usually dry but worth it. Last 1,3 km by not paved road

name: Horta de Sant Joan
description: Picknick area at the road from Horta de Sant Joan to Roques del Benet. Flat parking lot with picknick tables and a small playground, no facilites. At night there is no traffic. Beautiful view to the Roques.

name: Cliff Playa Galizano
description:
It's a gravel parking space on a cliff with superb views!
A local surf instructor told us about it.
We were told not to put out chairs or other camping stuff. 
No toilet, water or shower.

name: Grupotel Maritimo Mallorca
description: Very recommendable. The staff takes care very friendly and one feels always welcome. Clean and modern rooms. It is the best hotel that we ever had!! One feels like in the paradise. Who is not contented here, is not contented with itself. Really food!!! You will be inspired.

name: camping la estepa
description: Actually more a place for camping cars and caravans but the owner is very nice and suggested us the best suited places for tents. There is a service house that offers a kitchen, showers and a living room, all inclusive for 10 €. The pool next to the camp ground is extra for 4,50€. She gave us lots of information about the area. Very calm as the village only has 30 inhabitants and few light smog.

name: Albergue Casa del Pescador
description:
Albergue Casa del Pescador is set in Ambasmestas, on El Camino de Santiago pilgrimage route, 22 mi from Ponferrada and 11 mi from O Cebreiro. Guests can enjoy the on-site restaurant. Free private parking is available on site.

Some rooms feature views of the mountain or lake. Each room is equipped with a shared bathroom. Albergue Casa del Pescador features free WiFi . Other facilities at this property include an outdoor pool, an ecological garden and a sun terrace.

You will find a cash machine at the property. Guests can enjoy various activities in the surroundings, including fishing and hiking.

rated it 9.1

name: Camp Monastery de San Pedro de Arlanza
description:
The perfect wild camp spot in a wild foresty river valley. Protected from sight from the road. I camped here in January - nobody was here. I don’t know how it is in summer.
Also a very scenic drive through this valley. Also don’t miss the monastery and Lerma at the Eastern end of The Valley!

name: Parking Playa America
description: Parking on Playa América. Right over the beach. There are bars nearby and public toilets and showers.

name: Free Parking Cudillero
description: Free parking next to the port. Clean. near Cudillero down town

name: Camping Pantano de buseo
description: Government organized free campground in beautiful location (lakeside)

name: Praia de area
description: Parking right next to the beach at the end of a small road. You can see the lighthouse and sometimes dolphins in the evening. No facilities. Some locals parked here in the morning to go spearfishing.

name: O Cebreiro
description: Great place close to the Ethnografic Complex of O Cebreiro. Marvellous view over the landscape to the north. Over a sea of clouds. Picnic aerea with stone tables and benches.

name: Mountain Look Out
description: Side of the road pull out with a ledge for a bit of privacy.. beautiful view of mountain ranges and small villages. Super quiet spot. 10/10 recommend for a night stop!

name: Area recreativa Los Llanos
description: Big picknick area near Monachil. Lots of tables with shadow.

name: Cicita Bar Cafetería
description: Very cute café run by an Italian couple with very friendly staff. Looks small and not too special from the outside but inside it is really nice and they have amazing homemade foccacia, sandwiches, bocadillos, different coffee etc. for very good prices. “Cicita” is the name of the owner’s grandma and they really make you feel at home in an Italian family’s place. Good place to wait for the Fred Olsen ferries. Anyways don’t miss it when you are around!

name: Tagle
description: End of a dirt road. Good views. Flat. Narrow.

name: Area for Autocaravan
description:
Area for aurocaravan. It is free. It looks surrounded by buildings but finally it is not so bad. Close to a sports field. 
There is a tap with water but when we were there it wasn't working.

name: Between Guejar Sierra and Pradollano
description: Just one minute from the road from Guejar Sierra to Pradolano, a short rough track leads to this nice flat area.

name: Alto de la Escala
description: Nice little spot for one car surrounded with smaller pine trees, located 50 meters away from a very quiet road that goes towards a dam. Nice breeze from the wind, very nice especially in the summer:)

name: Lavaderos de la Reina
description: 12 km from Güejar Sierra. A small paved, then gravel road leads to the starting point of the nice hike to the Lavaderos de la Reina. At the parking lots you can stay overnight. Incredible view to Mulhacen and Pico del Veleta.

name: Camping El Peñoso
description: Nice place next to the beach. Very friendly owners. grass spots for tents. I paid 15€ for tent, bike and one person.No food on-site available but there is a bar.

name: Wild place with nice view
description:
small area with a very nice view on a plane.
close to a track, which lead only to an antenna (for mobile...)  so its very quit.

name: Camping Don Quijote
description:
Within bike distance to Salamanca. The plots are mostly on grass, the bathrooms, showers etc, are very clean and the price is fair. 
Quiet and with pool access and we were told that there is an excellent restaurant.

name: Termas de Barbantes
description:
Lovely place right on the river and next to free thermes, where you can swim.
Great view and very quiet. 
It’s all free.

name: Good over night spot
description: Great great great place! So much so see and do. We stayed here for 2 nights without fault. There are showers on the beach and toilets in town. Get a map from the tourist information place and it tells you what to do and where the toilets are. EXPLORE THIS AEREA! Amazing! It smells bad if the winds blowing in the wrong direction because a sewage station is at the back of the car park. But hey your living in a van

name: Lovely spot
description: Great spot for swimming, quiet. Good half way (ish) point for either coasts. It’s down a little ruggard track but don’t be alarmed the worst parts the top the rest is fine. Many flat spots to chose from if you have a good eye. It’s perfect if you go far right and the up a little bit under the trees. Our stone table we made might even still be there

name: Camping A Fonsagrada
description: Campsite with good facilities and amazing views of the surrounding countryside

name: Playa Otur
description: Natural beach sorounderd by cliffs with many trees. Blue flag. Small bar and public WC and showers from 10 to 18. Campers max 5,5m due to step and narrow access road, but well paved.

name: Thiermas
description: Lovely wild camp spot in the middle of mud lake which is very healing. Few campers around and locals bathing. Highly recommended. Leave the place clean! Fires allowed

name: By the river
description: Very calm village, only 6 people living there. Possible to sleep next to the village with van and camp in the forest next to the river.

name: Playa Berellin
description:
You are surrounded by nature ; cows, hills, trails and lovely beach. 
On the top of the hills, quiet and amazing place to rest with amazing view on the beach and nature. 
Beach is just 2 min walks and rather quiet even in August. 
10 euros to park for 24hours, no services, but on the beach there is a shower. Accessible for big truck more than 30Ft (road to get there a bit narrow but feasible)

name: Ondarra / La Arena - Parking Lot
description: Parking lot beside the street and around the corner. Nice small beach with showers toilets and water.

name: Andorra and Spain border
description: Beautiful spot on the border of Andorra and Spain. Incredible views there is space for few big rig vans. Its about half an hour drive to Andorra City Centre and 10 mins drive away there is cable car lift with fresh water access. It's little busy during the day but quiet at night.

name: Parque Palo - Sierra Nevada
description: wonderful site for all types of rigs. water stream near by in a pine Forest. defunct toilets from another era that don't work. a few people here but wonderful views and trails near by.

name: Ocean vew
description: We ate standing on an small peninsula, beautifully

name: Los Llaos Aparcamiento - San Vincente de la Barquera
description: Nice wide open grass Campground beside a Hostal. 100m to beach. Good surf spot. Hot shower and clean toilet. 10 EUR per Night with Camper.

name: Seira
description: Wild camping spot. No through road, Picnic tables, nice spot for a tent at the end of the road overlooking a river. Great views.

name: Hoz de Jaca
description:
Fountain in the village, next to the "bike service point". Average flow in August : 4'14" fort 10 litres.
you can park without hindering traffic.

name: wild quiet camp site
description: nice quiet camp site close to a track.  only for 4x4 vehicles.

name: Orbellido
description: It's a wild parking place, can put a tent too, next to a lake.

name: O Paio
description: Semi off rd down to quite nature camp spot, space for few cars. During the day few other cars may park there, but just to visit the beach. Fantastic view, close to nice beach, you hear the waves We saw also Dolfins here

name: Hugs of nature & mountain view
description: Only for smaller 4wd, like Land Rover Defender/e.g. with rooftop tent. The spot is small, but big enough. You get natural shade by trees, but still have a great view towards west (sunset) and mountains. There are some spiky plantes, we removed few on ground - so we had a good small area for table and chairs. Very very quiet - no people

name: choyo 2 Hotel
description: Cheap nice hotel, no parking but free safe place around. Clean and nice staff. 35 € for the double room, 18 € for single room. Restaurant and bar.

name: water
description: Water fountain in centre of recreational area.

name: the waterfall
description: We found this place late during the night. Not sure what to expect in the morning. The morning came with some pleasant surprises, a beautiful view to an old paper factory and a waterfall. Parked right in the middle of some view point. Just a short hike for some scenery views. Some locals walked by but did not approached us. Small garbage bag at site.

name: Camping Ciudad de leon
description:
Standard campsite but too many people and overused facilities. 
Since 2020 new owner. Now very clean, nice owners. Very quiet place a bit far away from León. A bar is open We paid Euro 20.- May = off season. Main season Euro 29.- Internet around bar quit well.

name: Castro de Pene Lopesa
description: You can take a good off-road way (you need offroad Experience) along the coastline from south west (Praia de Sartaña) to camp, very beautiful. The smaller camp spot have a great view, located higher, very quiet, surrounded by nice nature. No access to beach - I think? 😊

name: Noelia
description: It has a cafeteria because it's inside of the  albergue zone

name: Confurco Church
description: Nice place to camp with incredible views. I asked some people in the village and they allowed me to spend the night there. Possible to find water near the houses. I went in summer and weather was good. Possible to camp next the church or park next to the fence.

name: sardón de nos Frailes
description: spot bivouac wild at the edge of lac.c'est an old road asphalted, which is fast becoming out trail, but a loophole along to avoid the wrong way .... peace and tranquility, and fish jump to welcome you. lovers outdoor will be the Angels .....

name: Pantano de Ardisa
description: Good coverage of cellular. to 100m from the road.

name: Camping Caravaning Arija
description: Nice camping with lagoon, White sand,and some forest.

name: Cangas de Onis
description: Hotel, restaurant truck stop. Cheap rooms €25 per room. Not that friendly but what do you expect for €25! On a main road but perfectly good for an emergency stop!

name: river camp
description: Nice place next to a river. Occupied by a few camper vans but plenty more space

name: Caserío Pozueta
description: Excellent hostel for pilgrims, with incredible views and very good prices according to your needs.  Dinner and breakfast if requested

name: Mar Menor - Waterfront Car Park
description: Free Carpark next to the promenade the runs along the beach. Lots of spaces and quiet in the evening.

name: Surfers Beach
description:
Moderator Note: This place is accepted but please be certain you have permission to stay overnight.

It's a big parking spot directly at the sea. It's used by many vans, campers and daily visitors!
You're able to sleep in your car or hide a tent behind the dune.
A small restaurant and a surfboard rental/surf school is nearby.
If the parking spot feels uncertain for you, it's possible to sleep in the forest behind.

name: Camping Joncar Mar
description:
Good Place with Store, Pool, clean Facilities!
Friendly and helpful. 100 m away from the beach. They helped even to park in our 10 t Truck!
Price 35,20€ pn.
Only thing is that they charge extra for wifi. 2.€ per hour.

name: durango13
description: in summer, the very low level gives free choice to an immense compact land area accessible to all vehicles. average bathing because mud and mud are present. the village is above for refueling, and a restaurant is present ......

name: La Florida
description:
Great Hotel with view over the City of Barcelona and the Costa Brava. Parking infront of the Hotel for 21€. A few steps away its for free.
Spa and Sport inclusive.
Taxis and busses driving all day long into the central City if the Caming Van is to big for the high traffic.

name: Nice place near the lake
description: AT the end of the gravel road a little gravel parking.

name: Archidona
description: Camper Service Station. Maybe you can stay here during the night. it‘s not forbidden.

name: Archidona
description: Drinking Water for Campers and Mobile Homes for free

name: Free Camping Benagéber
description: Nice camping area for free! Enough space for caravans. There’s a small house with toilets and private showers. It’s very clean and there’s someone taking good care of this place. There’s also a picnic area with grill. We‘re enjoying our stay here! You can find this location an Google maps: Caravans and Motorhomes Area Benagéber

name: La Seu d'Urgell Camping
description:
Designated camper van parking. Dump, water and electricity for a few euros. Overnighting no longer free. Easy access for all rigs. Close to the old town with market on Saturday mornings. Bakery open on Sunday. Close to the Olympic wildwater canoe special. Quiet. 

there is a new area that you have to pay to enter, this new area is managed by "CAMPING-CAR PARK "

https://www.campingcarpark.com/es_ES/estancias/area-de-etapa-autocaravanas/catalogne/25-lerida/la-seu-durgell

but the rest of the park still free :)

name: Xalo Camper Van Park
description: Large gravel parking for camper vans, with water and dump. € 3 water and dump. € 5 overnight, water and dump. There are no signs leading you to this place. Coordinates of this spot are where the entrance gate is. You are allowed to open the gate yourself when it's closed. Prices are visible at the little concrete service point on the parking where you can dump and get water. In the morning somebody can show up to collect your 5 euro's. Easy access for all rigs. Masymas supermarket is your neighbour. The spot is close to the towncentre and the rastro (second hand market) on saturday morning. Wine is serious business in the Xalo (Jalon) valey, tourist info 100 metres. Cheers. Quiet.

name: Encoro das forcadas
description: Small flat parking lot at the northern site of the reservoir. You can have a swim here. Some houses around, but not disturbing.

name: quiet spot in the mountains
description: It's alongside a trail, very quiet and beautiful surroundings

name: Lookout Cabo Busto
description: Overnighter with impressive lookout,  left BEFORE the lighthouse.

name: El Verger Lacolada Launderette
description: Do it yourself Launderette. Prices: 12 kg € 6, 16 kg € 7, 21 kg € 9, dryer 20 minutes € 3. Also open on sunday.

name: In a field next to a reservoir
description:
It's a big field, but can be very boggy, so be careful when driving onto it. It's 4x4 only as the path towards it is difficult and steep, but there are several other spots alongside the reservoir that are accessible for all vehicles. 
Very quiet and beautiful. View of the lake and the mountains.

name: Camping Venta  de Contreras
description:
Campsite with insane scenery. Looks like something out of Red Dead Redemption but with the addition of a massive dam. 

Pitches are large and separated by nature so you feel like you’re truly camping in the outdoors. Can pick blackberries and wild rosemary for cooking and relax in the quiet. 

Electricity available and nice hot showers. 
Perfect for overlanders and campervans who want to be in nature and don’t want a super commercialised campsite that’s full of loud families. 

Really friendly camp dogs and cats. The big ginger cat is the softest cat in the world and will jump on your bed for strokes if you let him inside. 

Go to Lidl on the way for ease but he does have a mini shop and a bar anyway. 

Windy road down to campsite looks mental on google maps but it’s really wide and almost new tarmac so there are absolutely no issues getting in or out even with a 6 metre van. We saw some google reviews saying they couldn’t get their van down but those drivers should have their licence taken away because the road is bigger than most UK main roads. 

Paid €17.50 for two with campervan. Electricity is extra.

name: gr-249
description: nice place with good spot to put a tent. bring your own water

name: Small forest area
description: During the day people are taking walks here with their dogs or go running. After dawn it is at least during the week a quiet place to pitch a tent.

name: Toconera wild camp. Bikes, motorbikes and campers
description: Calm, open and nice place to camp. You can find non treated water (Good for cooking) and picnic tables. Nobody came here but probably weekend is more busy. Lots of trees for shadow.

name: Parque Regional Cuenca Alta Manzanares
description: Parking outside of La Pedriza national park. No vehicles are allowed inside the park after dark but it is OK to park here overnight. No facilities.

name: Camping Can Banal
description: A lovely campground between the trees. Very quiet in low season.

name: Campo de la Matanza
description:
Access from Highway A7 to Fortuna. Take RM423 to the lake. At right there is an old recreation area with stone tables and benches. Could welcome a dozaine of 4x4. Flat spaces on 4 terrasses.
We hear highway traffic.

name: Camping Nautic
description: Nice campsite with terraced sites with ocean view directly at the cliffs. Place is next to the city centre and harbour of L‘Ametlla de Mar.

name: parque de santillan
description: park with drinkable water. parking. possible to stay with a van

name: fuente romana
description: free water. near a park and cheap hostal

name: fontaine
description: free drinking water from tap along the street

name: Fuente del conego
description: free drinking water, bars and shops around

name: Ermita San Isidro
description:
Shaded area in the fields.
Shelter and open fire place.

name: Dirt track
description: Along a little used track plenty of spots to park and stay for the night, leave no trace!

name: Camping Cala Llevado
description: Very large campsite with 600 stands leveled around a terraced terrain so the stands are not that close and on different levels. 34 euro for 2 plus car or ask for ANWN discount To reduce to 21 euro if you are Dutch... In October perfectly quiet and all the space to be relatively alone for a campsite.

name: Secluded Wild Camp
description: Near small stream, enough space for 4 vehicles nice view in valley

name: Camping Las Casitas de las Arribes
description: Small camping, and not overcrowded, with an amazing women holder. Toilet and shower are clean and there is hot water! There is a small bar where you can order food and drinks. You have a town 10 mins at feet and some hiking trails near Duero river, amazing view, a lot of eagles. Around 15€ per night.

name: Jesa Cargo Aduanas
description:
My issue was as follows: I left the EU on a land border crossing in June 2018 (Bulgaria to Turkey) and entered the EU again on a flight from Colombia to Madrid in October 2019. Even though my motorcycle was bought & registered in Belgium (EU), customs insisted that any cargo arriving at the terminal needs to be cleared by means of an import declaration - something I didn't expect, since "it's just a Belgian bike re-entering in the EU". Also the fact that I didn't have an export declaration seemed to be an issue for them (I didn't ask for that when leaving the Bulgarian border, not even sure if you can get it there).

I went to some customs agencies, and "Jesa Cargo Aduanas" saved my day! Because of uncertainties (which codes to use, how to declare for a non-resident, how to import tax-free without an export document), Jesus went along to the customs office to discuss the matter with the officials directly - he knows everybody there. 

The issue was quickly resolved:
- use code C08 - 101 for tax free import - the agency will know what this is, and this was confirmed by the customs officials themselves
- get yourself registered in the customs system as a non-resident by means of your passport

Shortly after, Jesus filed the import declaration, and all was resolved. He really went out of his way to help me out, he's very knowledgeable, and just an overall great guy! He charged me 80 euros, what seemed a very reasonable price to me (other agencies quoted up to 325 euros + VAT, for the same job, and I'm sure they didn't really know what to do).

So if you're facing the same issue, go see Jesus! And probably also for any customs procedure involving vehicles, it's his specialty he said.

name: Beliera Campsite
description: A lovely well equipped campsite with everything you need if you have been spending time in the bush! incl. small bar,  pool (though empty when we were here in October), communal BBQ area, water and electricity etc. clean quiet and friendly.

name: Haunted Goat Run
description: Nice place by a stream but probably only usable when there aren't goats grazing here.  Easy to get a large caravan into this space - quite remote.  We called it "haunted" because of the old walls and general vib of the place

name: Municipal Forest
description: Beautiful place, nice pine forest, great views of valley below.  Town is close by - bring your own supplies -

name: Playa de Matale
description: Boat launch area, perfect to park a rig or pitch a tent, right beside the river, 2 kilometers from town.

name: next to the beach
description:
it's a place next to the beach. Some people say that you have pay in the summer season. But in September it's free. There are a lot of other camper.On the beach are Showers and Toilets. But the toilets are bad. 
Clear Water is near the campground

name: Area autocaravanes de Martinet
description: Official, communal camper site (Àrea autocaravanes) of the village of Martinet. Slightly sloping, large tarmac parking across the bridge from the centre. Free, quiet parking. Electricity € 1,00 for 8 hours. Free unisex toilet (1) and free, hot unisex shower (1). Shop, ATM, butchers, bakeries, barbershop, restaurants and bars all within walking distance. Perfect place for a night or two (max = 5 nights). Dump station with free drinking water on site.

name: Talleres Jose Cobo
description:
Mechanic preferred for trucks e.g. for:
  Engine, 
  Brakes,
  and changes of any kind

with over 35 years of experience

Telefon: +34.653.66.55.17

name: El Alamo
description:
Very fine spot on a flat field next to this very small town. Fresh water and shade. Very friendly people that are so glad to meet you. One cafe (cold meals only) and some supermercados on wheels at some days. Nobody speaks english. No public wifi. 

I even was sometimes invited for lunch, for diner, at a birthday party, for personal wifi and for drinks. 
I was even invited to use someone's small daytime summerhouse, garden and bathroom. And I even had a full fridge available (breakfast, lunch, coffee, beer, soup, all for free !). 

I stayed there 10 days and loved to be there !

name: Meson de Sancho
description:
Great hotel near port. Bar restaurant pool very clean. 
Parking.

name: El Grau De Castellón
description: Municipal campsite for motor homes only, no tents or caravans. Free for 48hrs max stay. On the beach at Castellón de la Plana. Maximum 48 vehicles although overflow happens on adjacent street. Public toilets, water and waste water facilities. Popular so need some luck to find a spot. Aim for planetarium if looking on maps. Max 8m rigs, no height restriction.

name: Camping Rio Ara
description: nice campground with lots of trees and space. no numbered/fix spots. good facilities, super friendly staff and nice view. we were there off season.

name: Parking Storage - Barcelona
description:
Overlanders Parking. 
We are Miquel & family, we are overland travellers with a Van, and offer a safe (with video 24/7) and private outside parking in our home. If you want to take a rest in your travel, you can leave your vehicle for 1 week, or even 12 months. Available for Camper, motorhomes, RV, Van, small trucks (max. 8m longer 3m alt). We can also transfer you to Barcelona or Girona airport in 45min. Our price are: 50€/1week, 90€/2weeks, 120€/3weeks, 150€/1Mounth 
 We have a plastic cover for your van.
You have possibility for electricity and water tank - extra tax.
You are welcome, and we have a Airb&b to accommodation at home: “a piece of heaven” Tona-Catalonia (Barcelona) https://www.airbnb.cat/rooms/34825961 
You need to contact us for reservation:             +34679958097         miquelvilaro@gmail.com
We are waiting for you and your adventures!

name: La panadella
description: It's a litle forest or grove, next to the path of the pilgrim

name: Posada de Valdeon
description: Large communal area, established for campervans, with hard stand, electricity and drinking water on each pitch. Right behind the local sports hall, of which the facilities can be used (shared showers, toilets for each sexe). There’s also a sink and some barbecues next to the building. Price per night € 10,- per pitch. Maximum stay: 4 nights. The small rural village of Posada de Valdeon is within walking distance with cafe, restaurants, bakery (the local shop closed down). NB there’s a sign saying big camper vans are not allowed on the raod to Cain, so the two spots described there may no longer be reached by larger vehicles!

name: Overlooking Igualada
description: Flat mountain top with brilliant view of the city of Igualada. Accessed via 200 m steep dirt road northwards via industrial sites. Daytime visited by dog ​​owners and Joggers. Quiet nights.

name: CAMPERCAT4X4
description:
After a big family trip from Alaska to Patagonia we decide to open our place to travellers.

Specially for travellers going from central Europe to Africa. Bikers and cyclists welcome.

Just 10 minutes from the highway and 10 minutes from the beach, day hikes. Good place if you want to take the AVE (high speed train) to Barcelona or visit the world heritage roman city of Tarragona. We offer transfer to both places.

Barbacue, swimming pool, wifi, electricity, wc, hot shower, rock climbing wall for children, porch for cooking, dogs welcome (we have one),...

Please contact first at +34 630861669

We also rent 4x4 campers.

Follow us in instagram, facebook or tweeter as CAMPERCAT4X4

name: Ermita la Mare de Deu de la Foia
description: Quiet pick-nick place with running water and tables. Perfect for a wild camp night (bivouac is allowed). Next to an ancient hermitage. Car access. Also perfect place to start your hike up to Montsant mountain (very beautiful and special mountain range).

name: Parking place in the national park
description:
A beautiful and quiet parking in the national park with beautiful views over the mountains. The only sound you hear at night is the clonking of the cowbells. Cows, horses and sheep are roaming free around you so remember to keep your pets on a leach. Several exellent hikes starts here. You can also find several similar spots just down the road. 
Trashcans can be found, no level spots on this parking. 
The road in have some traffic but is generally very quiet, the road is also quite steep and narrow so I would be extremely cautious about going with a bigger camper or van. If you are camping with a tent, this is probably not the best place to stay, but I am sure you can find many other spots in the forest.

name: Camping El Astral
description: ACSI approved campground, unfortunately a bit on the more expensive side for it's location. Price closer to 20 euro for 1 person and a car, it should in my opinion be closer to 10 offseason. Washing machine an extra 3,50 (soap included) Dryer an extra 3,50. Electricity extra so it adds up. Clean bathroom and toilets and shower warm and friendly customer service.

name: Gravel parking
description: Very beautiful and peaceful gravel area between cork oaks. Several potential places along the gravel road. Some noise from the secondary road nearby.

name: Asphalt parking by a lake
description:
A small parking place by a lake, where swimming most likely is possible. Lots of trash everywhere although garbage bins can be found on the parking, this is also a popular place for the free roaming cattle so the terrain is a minefield. 
BBQ spots next to the parking and hiking/cycling trails start here. Might be a busy place during the summer. Quite a narrow road in, but with good surface. I had a good night here.
Minimarket in the town with very nice staff.

name: Small field next to the road
description:
A small field next to the road behind some bushes. Asked the friendly farmer who stopped by if would be ok to stay for one night - it was no problem.
I picked up some trash before I left, the place is a bit dirty and the river is not recommended to use in any way (also fenced off). Some noise from the road during the evening. Had a good night sleep.

name: Camping S‘Abanell
description:
Open all year. Only the promenade with a small street separates the square from the fine, enchanting pebble beach. At this time of year there are almost only long term campers there and the back seats with sea view are all free. Washing machine and dryer available, as well as all sanitary facilities. Dogs allowed, many restaurants around, but currently all are closed. Super nice reception. I paid for me, dog, camper and electricity about 15 €.

Ganzjährig geöffnet. Nur die Promenade mit einer kleinen Straße trennt den Platz vom feinen, zauberhaften Kiesstrand. Zu dieser Jahreszeit sind fast nur Langzeitcamper da und die hinteren Plätze mit Meerblick sind alle frei. Waschmaschine und Trockner vorhanden, sowie alle sanitären Anlagen. Hunde erlaubt, viele Restaurants rundherum, die aktuell jedoch alle geschlossen sind. Super nette Rezeption. Bezahlt habe ich für mich, Hund, WoMo und Strom ca. 15€.

name: Camping Playa y Fiesta
description:
Grenzgenial parking space right on the water! In the summer probably very crowded, this time a real dream. Nice reception, open all year, full supply. 14 € per night incl. Electricity. Pool and restaurant are closed at this time of year, at the reception there is bread to buy in the morning. Nearest supermarket about 5 km away.

Grenzgenialer Stellplatz direkt am Wasser! Im Sommer wahrscheinlich sehr voll, um diese Zeit ein echter Traum. Nette Rezeption, ganzjährig geöffnet, volle Versorgung. 14€ pro Nacht inkl. Strom. Um diese Jahreszeit sind Pool und Restaurant geschlossen, an der Rezeption gibt es morgens Brot zu kaufen. Nächster Supermarkt in ca. 5 km Entfernung.

name: Dunes Area Camper
description:
simple place with very nice owner. All services. Open all year. 11euros incl electric
.....
Einfacher, umzäunter Schotterplatz mit suuuper nettem Betreiber und allem Service. Ganzjährig geöffnet, 11€ inkl. Strom.

name: Beautiful spot by the river
description: Loads of space next a river. open grass to park on. many nice level areas. Plenty fire pits and lots of wood around. The road is across the river but can't be seen. Huge cliffs around.

name: Parking motorhome Free
description: Big place, Parking Free near gas Staion.

name: CAMPING CALONGE
description:
Beautiful organized campsite in the middle of the pines forest. Swimming pool, good shaded areas and restaurant.
Wild forest around with sandy areas and Cega River behind.
Open only on july and august.

Precioso camping en medio de los pinares. Tiene piscina, zona recreativa y muy buena sombra.
Abierto sólo en julio y agosto.

name: Parking
description: Parking Free in the street, big place near the metro.

name: Gas Station
description: Gas Station water. Free. Near sea. Potable.

name: Refugio El Zarcejo
description: Small hut with fire place and big door with no window. Perfect to do a bivy.

name: Parking at Gavà beach
description:
One of the many parking spots next to Platja de Gavà. I stayed here two nights with my dog, car and rooftoptent. In the evening some cars came to the parking lot but didn't stop. In the early morning fisherman arrived, but didn't say anything except for hi.
Each place to enter the beach in Gavà has a (cold) shower and garbage bins. I used the water of the shower for making tea and preparing dinner, don't know if it's safe to drink without boiling.
 
Don't know if they check more strictly during summer period.

name: Benicassim- parking spot in the mountains along the CV 147.
description: This spot is famous for its views towards Benicàssim and the sea. There is also a great steep hike to a ruin of an old monastery of about 1.5 hours. Fantastic place. Stayed for 2 nights. No facilities but at the foot of the mountain there is a dumping station and water.

name: Island on the reservoir
description:
There is a peninsula out to a forested island on a big lake. There is some sort of "adventure park" on the way down. all closed up in November. toilets are open. garbage cans etc. Very quiet and many places to choose from

there are water tape but unsure if potable.

unsure of what is available when the adventure park is open.

name: Government Campsite
description: Huge place next a small stream. water spillway of some kind. take your first hard left at the bottom of the hill to find the good spot. Carry on down the road and past the steps to the main spot. No one around in November. Interesting spot worth checking out. lots of offroading nearby. some covered tables and an indoor fireplace.

name: Site among pine trees
description: Huge site amongst pines. BBQ shacks, toilets, picnic benches, garbage. Loads of room. Gravel road access but fine for any vehicle. Shelter for cyclists. Shows there are showers on the sign but all closed in November. Two toilet stalls were left open

name: Quiet and clean overnighter
description: Quiet and clean overnighter, no services, only a short walk to the village. We took a walk into the village but both restaurants were closed, maybe they only open in the evening not sure. Nothing special but it's free.

name: Area Camper Barcelona Beach, Cabrera de Mar
description:
This is a great, safe and quiet campground. The perfect starting point to visit Barcelona, shopping center only a 5-minute walk. The train station less than 
a 10-minute walk and the train will take you right into the center of Barcelona.

name: Tetería Kasbah
description: Great place for tea and sweet treats (they also have a couple of gluten free options).  They also have meals like tajin.  Nice ambiance.  Cozy.

name: Linás de Broto
description: Small place near the river. Magnificient view. Very guiet.

name: Alfaro
description: Parking close to the river Ebro. Quiet place. Good for a night.

name: Hoyos del Espino
description:
Parking place near the village
and info center.  Restaurants 500 m.

name: Mohedas de Granadilla
description: Parking near the lake. Nice view over the water and the mountains.

name: Plasencia
description: Huge park. Near the reservoir. Many nice spots with shade.

name: Casilas de Goria
description: Place near the river Alagon. In the middle of nowhere. No shade, but a beautiful spot. Jump in the river.

name: Malpartida de Caseres
description: Huge picknick area. Lots of nice places under the trees. Can be busy in summer.

name: Santa Marina. Ha
description: Parking near the church. Very  peacefull. Good for a stopover.

name: Ford Ferri-Movil
description: Huge Ford Dealer, with great Service. We called yesterday for an oil change abd they gave us a space today. Could bring the Van in the morning and was ready in the evening (we decided to go to the city in the meantime, car was ready much earlier). Fair price, good work! I have seen that they do service for other brands as well.

name: Land Rover Club Spain
description: +34 603 90 22 62 send Rafa via Whats App a message if you have problems with your Landy, they dint speak English, but use translator. Perfect mechanics with passion. They also have a service truck to get you when you can not drive anymore.

name: Bar Moreneta
description: The best place ever if you like good meat and tapas, we came here will local people.

name: Parking close to climbing area
description: Very nice natural place close to camping and hiking area, no water, no toilet. You can swim in the river nearby. Very safe and others sleeping here in there busses. In summer and on weekends its busy, but no problem at all. We stayed 3 nights

name: Cantonigros
description: Free campsite for vans in Cantonigros village. Water, electricity and dump station.

name: Camping Cáceres
description: Large site with private bathrooms, shop, pool, restaurant etc etc. The good news: open all year long hence this notification.

name: Sant Feliu de Guixols
description: Parking spot, also for big rigs, with dumping station. Euro 5 per night; tickets can be bought at the tourist Office which is located next to the monastery. 5 min walking to the centre of the very nice town.

name: overnighter before catching the ferry to Morocco
description: Quiet overnight spot right next to the ticket office for the ferry to Morocco. A lot of motorhomes stay here before departing for Morocco. Good internet if you have your own Sim card, great shopping centres in walking distance.

name: Territorio Tortuga
description: Sand parking directly next to a beautiful beach. We stayed here with a couple of camper vans and me with my rooftoptent. No water, shower or toilets, but there are garbage bins. Some hiking paths around with a small cave and beautiful viewpoints.

name: Lanzarote
description: wonderful sleeping place over the see.   on the edge of the national park in lanzarote.

name: El Chorro Free Water
description: Tap with standard thread. Parking spot right next so a hose can reach your van.

name: Lake side camp
description: Lots of room along a lake. Beware ground turning to muck after rain! Fire rings, picnic bench etc. No one around in December but looks well used. Nice views

name: Riverside
description: This is a large free parking lot amongst the pine trees near the end point and shuttle bus stop for Caminita del Rey. No services except a 4G cell signal. A small grocery store near by and food and drink kiosks when trail is open. You must book online to do the trail. Price is €10 pp for the walk. The shuttle bus takes you near the start point from here. Pretty quiet at night unless you get noisy neighbors.

name: Fuentes Blancas
description:
Campground with really good hot showers! Nice in December! 18€ per night, car, 2persons. Public bus to Burgos.

Still a very nice and quiet place. Price between Euro 22.- and 30.- in may. A bit far away to town. God to have a bike with.

name: Camping Regio
description: Open all year, hot showers, 17€/night, 2 persons, car, no electricity. Public bus to Salamanca.

name: Finca La Isa, Tejeda
description: Eco Hostel with huge free spaces, very welcoming atmosphere! Bathroom, showers, breakfast-Buffet for 7 €, homemade dinners on pre-order € 10

name: Beach Parking
description:
Public parking place next to the beach behind a hotel, no signs about camping. 
Good place for surfing.

name: Guadamia Recreation Area
description: nice spot with a great view, some people during the day, at night no other people here in December,  fresh water, benches and tables, barbeque,  no beach etc. you are above sea level, great place for hikes along the coast

name: Los Puercos Free Camp
description: Large grassy and a bit rocky area with trees. Entrance from N430 at km. 440 minus 100 meters. Easy access for all rigs. Firm gravel or grass, secluded or view. Y'll find it here. With also perfect little hideway spots for push/motor bikers. 3G. Altitude of 1 kilometer make temp drop after sunset.

name: Playa de Balerma
description:
Long beach with possibilities to stay close or even on the sand at water line.
It was quite, only few fishers and joggers around.

No Policia or Guardia seen, no signs, so staying for 24 hours without doing camping (putting things out like table, etc.) should be allowed.

name: Plateau in Deserta de Tabernas
description:
A hidden plateau on half height between river bed and plateaus around. So it's possible to stay without sightline to anyone passing by.

Was there for three nights and made small controlled fire (there was plenty of dead dry wood).
Only dew offroader passed the road through the river.

Shortest legal access only via the River Bed, other Track going direct to national Street is blocked by a chain at the end.

It's in middle of beautiful nature, no trash or paper laying around.
So please keep it clean like this and be safe with fire (no fire when windy, have enough water or extinguisher accessible, don't leave fire alone)!

name: Beautiful Playas Sombrerico
description:
Both beaches are beautiful; many space to stay,l; Hiking possible (a 3 Hour round over the hills); ground mostly straight; Mobile net Connection partially bad or not possible; when heavily raining is not possible to go in or out; close to Chiringuito are cold showers and open toilets (the owner of the Chiringuito is cool, please keep all clean); from the position the beach along to north was a natural water source;
policia was cool.

name: Bush next to the road
description: Andalucía is all covered with fences, so while this spot isn’t ideal at all it is at least something. No fireplace nor wood, and no water source – just a tiny place to set a tent and spent a night for free.

name: Marina Alcaidesa
description: This is a caravan parking inside the marina. Toilets are closed at night but it does have a dumping station and a laundry. Great if you are coming or heading to Morocco. Great views to Gibraltar.

name: Portillo del Lazar
description: Nice place and view, very quiet at night.

name: Parking close to caminito del Rey
description: Small parking lot, dead end road, quiet, view point nearby.

name: Pension Calatrava
description:
Cheap hotel for 25€ a night, basically a trucker restaurant/motel. There’s a better/more expensive hotel attached (same owner) if you prefer more luxus. But the rooms are good, pretty big, with AC/heater and bathroom.
Close to the race track and the Spaghetti Western filming locations (Texas Hollywood, Mini Hollywood and Western Leone)

name: mirador del guadiamar
description: Nice place with wonderfull views. Picnic area without tables or services very quiet.

name: Hotel Valcarce
description: A stop overnight place with all the necessary amenities. We took a room as it is winter but you can camp in the parking and use showers and toilets if you need.

name: Aldagaia
description:
4 beautifully designed self-catering apartments with kitchen area, washing machine, WIFI, set in a small apple orchard. Recently developed in a lovely traditional stone building in the interesting and bustling town of Hernani, just outside San Sebastián/Donostia in the Basque Country.
Space in the forecourt to park large vehicles.
The owner is really friendly and helpful, even asked a local mechanic to help us with some minor work to our Landcruiser.

name: Fuente San Ta
description: very good spring water directly on the street

name: Área Recreativa Sedilla
description: very nice and big picnic place with tables and barbecue grills and water  (and toilets and shower, but these are closed) , but the road to the hill is very small and tight, only for small vehicles

name: Fuente
description: it is a small spring with good water, some locals fill their bottles,  some picnic tables around, nice place

name: Fuente de pesca
description: spring with good water, some picnic table around, very nice area for hiking

name: Customs-Immigration Parking
description: Waiting area for the border crossing by car. Expect very long waiting times for we were here in down season waiting for 3 hours. This is complementary to get to the border by car

name: Camping Havana
description: small quiet camping place directly on the beach between greenhouses.  clean showers and toilettes. mostly long time campers. okay for one night.

name: Beach parking
description: very nice place, but only for cars to 5m length allowed !, the police was 6 p.m. here and all motorhomes about 5m length must move

name: Roses
description:
Close to Roses. Quiet place except some dog barking in the distance.
Not a fancy place but good for one night.
Space for about 10 vehicles.
Free of charge.

name: Parking Autocaravanas La Jábega
description:
ADMIN NOTE:  user reports location seems to be seasonal. 

More a parking lot, around 50 caravans, trucks and RVs parked there long term. You can also camp here, 13€ per night all inclusive. Its not pretty though. There's weak WiFi, very clean showers and toilets and a washing machine.

name: Erratzu parking
description: Nice parking located in the village of Erratzu. Beautiful views. Public toilets are in the towns small center, which also has a view restaurants. Bring your own toiletpaper ;-)

name: Barruecos
description: Beautiful place, with a couple of lakes and spectacular landscapes. A battle of Game of Thrones was filmed here.

name: Good Place
description: Good place but not for big trucks. Nice view on Benidorm

name: Zaragoza Motorhome Area
description:
Reserved area for 36 camper vans. 10 minutes to the city center and most of the tourist spots by tramway. 
Free of charge inclusive fresh water and dumping.
Maximum stay 72 hours.
60% of the parking positions were occupied during my visit.

name: Albarracín
description: Parking behind Dinopolis. Quiet. Hiking possibility.

name: safe space in the Hills
description: Only for one car. We found this place with a 6m Bus. This place for big rigs is not possible and not over 3.2 metres high. Nobody here

name: Viewpoint near Xàbia
description: Quiet spot except the waves. Nice view in the small bay.

name: El Castell de Guadalest
description:
Parking area below the street Level. Quiet. Parking fee was 2 €.
Restaurants and bars are close to the spot.

name: Hillside
description:
Wild camping place along the dirt road on a hill. You have a nice view over the town Conjunt de Castell d'Aro Castell-Platja d'Aro. Completely quiet, no one here. A local said that it’s totally fine when we stay for the night.
The path is pretty steep. I would recommend a 4x4 vehicle. We did it with a 4x4 Sprinter Van pretty easy in dry conditions. In wet conditions I probably would not have tried it with a 3,5 ton Sprinter van.

name: nice and quiet
description: nice and quiet stayed here for a couple of nights, no one will hassle you. The road in is a couple of hundred metres dirt road but not a problem. There are fire places and there is a water pipe next to one of the buildings. We have seen a lot of people drinking from the pipe and after trying it myself the water appears to be good mountain water.

name: Casa de baños (public showers)
description: Public showers in Madrid, 0.50€ for 20 min, nice hot water + clean showers.

name: Spain
description: We moved on to this location, as a result of having been on from Delta Ebro by the police .... they were charming but firm. This location is frequented by kite surfers and people who fish. It was also considered to be acceptable by the police. Easily possible to camp discreetly ... mosquitoes could be a problem as the temperatures rise.

name: Carboneras
description:
Apparently camping in the National Park is an absolute no-no. However this location is considered to be acceptable .... other vans were here too. 
Approaching Carbonates from the N341 take first exit on roundabout along AL-5106. Take second track on right several hundred meters from the roundabout to cul de sac bordered by sea and cliffs. Quiet other than waves crashing at high water.

name: sacred oak
description: it's in the middle of the olive yard. there's a huge magnificant oak three surrounded with olives. it's a private land. here the local youth & artists organize private parties. just a night before was one so I stayed for another night.

name: Wild campsite with sea views
description: Nice spot for cyclist or off road motorbikes. Flat and calm place next the mountains. To arrive there, go just to a big forniture store called VETA (google maps) , take the path in the other side of the road and you can arrive the place.

name: Almeria Port
description: a well equipped port with a confusing process. there's a cafeteria, restaurant, 24 hour supermarket, toilets, a waiting area and showers (although the showers were locked when I tried them). Follow the yellow signs to FERRYS and you'll loop around the ticketing building to a parking area. there is no order to the parking, just stop wherever. at some point you'll get waved forward and everyone pushes up, motorcycles (and ATVs) can go first. you'll need printed copies of your ticket (2x/each for passenger and vehicle)

name: Camping La Piscina
description: Camping at the outside of the small town Bicorp with restaurant and some sports installations. Also a pool in summer

name: Flat ground fit for big truck or 2 cars
description: Small sort of parking lot near a apple tree yard. Stayed for one night, no services but really quiet at night. Near the road are multiple places to park, except the private roads but these have a sign.

name: Direct lake access and view of Iznajar
description: Long dirt/gravel road (5km). Last part is a Very steep descending to the lake. 4x4 recommended, when wet mandatory!!Really beautiful view over the lake and the illuminated city Iznajar. A lot of tiny mosquitoes though.

name: Elevated position above bbq & picnic are.
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Please check local and country laws to confirm wild camping is allowed in this area. 

We found this site as a result of the official camp site at Montillana closed. It is almost directly opposite and sign posted. We made very little noise and exposed no obvious lighting. It is on a completely level piece of ground with spectacular views of the lake. There is also a lot cover so we were really well camouflaged. There was absolutely no disturbance at all.

name: Aitona
description:
It is a motorhome area with gray and black water emptying services. Equipped with drinking water. 
---
Es un área de Autocaravanas con servicios de vaciado de aguas grises y negras. Dotado de agua potable.

name: Secans del Segrià i Utxesa
description:
It is a small plane with several trees that provide shade and is next to the gates that regulate the level of the Utxesa reservoir and the Serós canal. About 150 m away is the information point called La Fusteria, with drinking water and WC.
----
Es un pequeño plano con varios árboles que dan sombra y está junto a las compuertas que regulan el nivel del pantano de Utxesa y el canal de Serós. A unos 150 m está el punto de información llamado La Fusteria, con agua potable y WC

name: Parco de geolog Jose
description: I slept several day in the Twingo here. Very nice place. People very friendly. Very close to the center. There's a drinkable public tap water & a public toilet. My colleague & I used this place cause we were performing in the streets in the center every day. Just need to be very quiet & respectful to all the other users of the park!

name: Camping la Fundicion
description:
Average camping away from towns in a nice valley. I was first asked for 19€ (price for a spot, vehicle, 2 persons and power in low season) found it a bit much for a single cyclist and paid 9,9€ after discussion ( 1 small tent and one adult).
no mobil network. wifi near reception.

name: Overlooking the forest
description: Great flat campsite in the middle of nowhere. Space for at least 10 tents. Must have a 4x4 to get here. Very narrow road. Need a 4WD but we were there with a vw tiguan with highway tires

name: Near Almeria highway
description:
Nice clean parking near a gas station. 
water and wc and wifi at the gas station.

name: Sant Hilari Sacalm RV area
description:
Parking for RV, water available, flush for camper van and electricity (have to ask at the nearby swimming pool, dont know the price)
Also some flat space on grass for pitching the tent
Toilets during daytime at the nearby swimming pool

name: Santa Cecilia Ermitage
description:
Flat grassy area next to Santa Cecilia chapel, tents only
At the edge of the forest, trees to protect from dew.

name: Home
description: I'm an overlander just arrived at home by the currently virus situation. I offer others overlanders stucked in Spain a place to stay for free with water, toilet, kitchen etc. I also have a couple of bedrooms if you travel with a tent

name: Free Campervan Services (Drinking Water & Waste Disposal)
description: Designated parking for campers with excellent services - drinking water, Black waste disposal and grey waste disposal. No problems staying her overnight. Close to a university so a little bit noisy in the morning but not bothersome. Safe area.

name: Near Gor on the way to Gorafe
description: Nice Spot with greate landscape and view on the snow covered Mountains. Very quite.

name: Lavomatic - Washing Machines
description: Open 24hs - Wash 8kg 4.5€, Dry 3€ - Buy the tokens at the gas station

name: very nice place between the trees
description: very nice place between the trees. extremely quiet, very pleasant climate.  beautiful hiking routes.

name: Malpaso
description: Beautiful viewpoint with a view to La Palma and La Gomera.

name: Playa del Rostro
description: Great river beach. There is also a boat with excursion by the river. During the night the peace comes and it's wonderfull

name: Camarzana de Tera
description: Great place near the River Tera. There is also an informal camping near the threes.

name: Playa de Gerra
description:
Camping Meadow close to the sea, cold water shower and toilettes.
Ground is not flat.
Private ground, guy comes about 22:00 to collect the money.

5€ Tent
10€ Caravan

Possible for every vehicle.

name: Refugio Raso Cubillos Urbion
description:
Public mountain shelter with a fireplace, chair and table. Fresh in summer, ok in winter.
Perfect spot for one night!

name: Alos de Balaguer
description: Campsite near the River with a little Fuente, tables. Phone signal. 4 Places. No WC

name: Pensión Mosende
description: Great value Hostel. Single & Double rooms. Cheaper and better equipped than some Hotels that I have stayed in. Recommended.

name: Pista Blanca
description: ideal for camping. looking at the stars . no water, no establishment camping

name: Rest Area
description: Green big area with tables, BBQ and fountain with potable water to motorhomes. You can put tent, but at 9am you must remove it. It is a beautiful place with sea views.

name: Matalascañas dune path
description:
Close to the sea, quiet, no facilites in winter
near Doñana national Park.
nice dune beach

name: canyon de horadada
description:
Close to Aguilar del Campoo, really nice place, no facilites, just nature, very quiet. you need a 4x4 to get there.
beautiful place.

name: Gingueta Water
description:
Good fountain. Parking very close. Water runs fast.
---
guter brunnen. Parkplatz sehr nahe. wasser läuft schnell.

name: close to barniedo de la reina
description:
Taken the dirt road, 500 meters.
nice place close to the river . there is a small
waterfall.
no facilities

name: Bomaigua
description: Parkplatz der Seilbahnstation. Mit toller Aussicht.Teerplatz. Am Ende bei Pfosten zwei sehr gut.

name: Caravia
description:
Close to the tarred road. AT the source, take the dirt road. On the top you can park.
quiet place. No facilities.

name: Mirador Heliport
description:
A few meters in front of a great vantage point is a small nice place but without shadow. Accessible via a gravel road. At 1850 meters, it winds wonderfully through the mobile.

Wenige Meter vor einem tollen Aussichtspunkt ist ein kleiner netter Platz jedoch ohne Schatten. Erreichbar über eine Schotterstrasse. Auf 1850 Meter windet es wunderbar durchs Mobil.

name: Gijón, mirador de la providencia
description:
we slept on the parking .
view point to the haven and the sea .
very windy, nice place.

name: Tremolera
description:
Right on the stream. The road can still be heard. Nice for an evening.

Direckt am Bach. Die Strasse ist noch hörbar. Nett für einen Abend.

name: Camping Lizarra
description:
A campsite near Estella-Lizarra. Paid 10 euros for the night in my tent with bicycle on a non powered site. Many families were there, so I guess it should be quiet most nights. powered sites costs more. I was able to charge my phone at the reception. there might be some power outlets around the reception building. 

They have Football and basketball field, swimming pool. Also Minigolf and table tennis, some rental fee might be required.

name: Oceanfront
description:
for 4x4, in front of the sea.
really nice and quiet. windy
beautiful view

name: beach Xove
description:
very nice place, quiet, close to the sea, beautiful view.
no facilities

name: Área A Praíña Acampada Itinerante
description:
Lovely campsite in Pontevea, along side the river.

A five minutes walk of the town (restaurants, supermarkets, etc) and 20 minutes (highway) of Santiago de Compostela. 

The site is managed by Pedro (695239911). He is the one to talk to book the stay.

name: Rocky road
description: Hammock site off the side of a rocky road. A couple of trees off the side of a backcountry rocky road. Perfect campsite for the night.

name: acantilados de Loiba
description:
A great view over the cliff where you can park. nice place for the night.
A lot of people during the  day and very quiet during the night.
there is a chiringuito if you want to drink and eat something.

name: Rinhlo Ocean View
description: Perfect ocean view camping spot, protected from wind overlooking the village of Rinhlo. Very quiet large place on a dead end road. Only some occasional fishermen passing by. Narrow rocky access road, but 4x4 not required.

name: Santiago de la espada
description:
Wild camping near to a spring. Forniture bench and tables. BBQ point.
Perfect for 1 night. Hide tent, not sure if allowed, I stayed and no problem

name: Playa Gueirúa
description: Spectacular sunset and sunrise. Access via steep and rocky descent towards the beach. Only possible with good 4x4. There are some small grass plots, but leveling of the car is required. Not so easy, but very rewarding (this is the reason why you are traveling with 4x4 and rooftop tent).

name: lake near Jarosa s road
description:
Nice place close to a lake ( not possible to swim) under pine trees( smell very good).
There are  lots of trails to walk.
Near , there is a restaurant so during the day there is a lot of people.
quiet during the night.

name: Parking at Church and cemetery
description: Nice quiet place with toilet, running water and small parking.

name: Camper parking in Besalú
description:
Parking area for campers across from Information center. 

Walking distance to town.
