Mixed reviews on Park4night. 

No toilets at night.  Maybe during the day at information center.  

There appeared to be a dump area, but not confirmed as we don’t require that service.

name: CAMPING RODAS
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Camping Rodas is a family run campsite located at the entrance of the town of Roses and very close to the beach. A perfect place to enjoy your holidays with family or friends, staying on one of our pitches, surrounded by trees or in a comfortable mobile home. Located in a quiet spot, this is the perfect location to relax and enjoy the many activities, a privileged and unique area such as the Bay of Roses and its landscape, culture, gastronomy and recreational range.

name: Camping Ixeia - motorbike friendly
description: Very good camping ground with everything you need. Owner is very helpful and since he is motorbiker gives a little discount to all bikers. Payed 10€ a night with motorbike and tent. Lots of place also for bigger cars and off-roaders. For campervans there is a better site a little bit down the road. Good food and very nice people around! #freiheitenwelt

name: Camping at Beach
description:
Nice little place with beach (tiny) close and open view for sunset. 4x4 and motorbikes can enter. Locals do so too for fishing... 
#freiheitenwelt

name: Jandia beach
description:
Nice spot next to the Iberostar Selection Hotel. 

If driving towards Morro Jable, turn left, right before the roundabout. 

Next to the road, behind a tree line but quite quiet at night. Walking distance to the beach 3 minutes. Ventura Shopping Mall with Spar Supermarket and basic restaurants 3 minutes walking distance.

name: Seville visit campsite
description:
Perfect if you want to visit Seville. Storage for campers but also possibility to park outside behind the building. 
Nothing fancy. don't expect a campground but for 10€/24h (1€ for each additional hour) it's perfect. Bus to Seville stops right in front of the place and takes you in 20 min to the city center.
Toilet and water dump, electricity and water tap.
Shower and toilets available. 

Very nice welcome with useful information. 
Yes its near an airport, highway and railway. So there is some noise.  Nothing that really bothered us. 

There was plenty of space when we there. We were able to install chairs and table, this might not always be possible.

name: close to bardenas desert
description: accessible in dry season, very quiet place,

name: piscina fluvial
description: Very nice place. River, possibility swing.

name: Wild Camp at Ruin
description: Quiet spot next to an old house - more like a ruin. Nice mountains around. Enough place for all kind of vehicles around.

name: Camping Canon do Sil
description: well organised site with a small shop and restaurant open for breakfast and dinner (8-10pm). has some cabins and pods, several hook ups, it may be difficult for very large motor homes to make it up the steep and narrow canon roads. has the most amazing miradors. clean toilets and showers, quiet off season. highly recommended

name: Area Recreativa El Azud
description: Just off the A1512. Mostly flat gravel track for approx 20 metres, it's fine for a car if you go slowly. Nice and flat at the bottom with a river running past. Close to the road but not much traffic at night.

name: Montjoi
description:
Behind  a house that looks to be empty most part of the year except summers, the place is tiny but there fit a 2 people tend, it's not a place where people walk through, but sometimes you can hear some cars near in the main Street. 
if you travel by car or moto you can park it 5 mts away in a flat space. 

ESPAGNOL
lugar pequeño donde cabe una tienda doble, esta escondido a pesar de estar cerca de un pueblo de vacaciones, si vas en coche, moto puedes dejarlo un poco más abajo en una explanada, la bici se puede dejar detrás de un arbusto más o menos escondida

name: Quiet place - motorcycle access
description: Quiet and hidden place a hundred meters from the road, suitable for trail motorcycles.

name: REC ON Project
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

We are Paulina and Bart and we have realised our dream by renovating an Andalusian farmhouse near Velez Rubio during COVID-19.
Now our eco village is ready to welcome travellers and van-lifers with open minds and warm hearts to join our community and experience like never before.

In our eco village you can be completely free or you can eat, drink, work and play with us!
You can enjoy nature by taking beautiful walks, tours or just relax and enjoy the silence.

Check out our website www.Rec-on.es to find out more about us or send us a message!
If you’re looking for a work-away experience to join us as a volunteer, we also have an house with rooms and all the facilities you need.

Enjoy the video on youtube at https://bit.ly/31FFrzK  and we are looking forward to meeting you.

Hasta luego!!

name: Grassy flat spot near Belsué
description: Grassy flat spot just near Belsué. Place for 2-3 tents. It can be accesed by foot or bike.

name: Rock climbing heaven
description: Big recreational area with lots of good places to camp. No signs prohibiting anything. At 500m high so not cold. Good reception. No amenities. Very clean. During the days families and groups of rock climbers visit. Entry  is very rocky for 20 m preventing normal cars to drive up.

name: Track off the N630 under the A66
description: Two options here. Firstly if it’s raining the road under the A66 is wide and flat and can accommodate any length vehicle although you might have to back out it in. Secondly, the lane has a flat gravel/sand area at the bottom for 2/3 vehicles. No facilities and motorway next to you so maybe noisy in summer, but it’s December and no traffic

name: Ugan Beach
description: Sheltered little rocky beach. The road leading to it has some nice camping spots sheltered from the wind by trees! Easy offroad acces. Lots of different spots to camp.

name: Port Lligat
description:
Village car park wich can accommodate up to 20 campers. Near the water, very quiet.
I assume that restriction for RV may apply during summer.

name: Tosal de can bota
description: Wide spot in the middle of the pine trees.

name: bassa de l'om
description: spot for one vehicle only on the edge of a small hill

name: Morrolius
description: Single spot in a wide turn on remote dirt track

name: Water tank basement
description: round flat surface formerly used for water tank. perfect spot for one camper

name: Els Fontanals
description: Single spot near a water tank, close to the track

name: near the laguna
description: small car park for people who want to walk around. Room for 2 campers maximum, not flat but really quiet

name: Espuña
description: single spot on a dead end track, stuning view and very quiet

name: Recinto Ferial Arjonilla
description:
Informed by the village council that this area is planned to be developed further to provide facilities for motorhomes.
At present the council are happy for visitors to stay but there are no facilities open.
They have already installed electrical points, water outlets and toilet and shower facilities but as yet they are not accessable.
The village has a number of olive factories, one which provides tours. A museum, castle ruins and an air raid shelter.
There is a fresh fruit and vegetable store and also a small supermarket. There are cafés and bars also. 
In the centre of the village is a beautiful church.

name: Isla Cristina
description: very nice camp with equipment.  Trees, shade, small shop.  Off-season.  ena 18 eur incluide electricity water ... Good dealings

name: quit valley on Gomera
description:
Offroad into a quiet valley with abandoned houses. From this place, next to an old house, there are many walking paths. Not recommended to drive further, or up the mountain, gets very rough. Amazing views, easy to see mountain Teide on Tenerife.
Flat space to park, 4G cell coverage, bee hives nearby (no hassle).

name: Wohnmobil Stellplatz  am Ebro
description: Municipal Campground  directly at the river Ebro. Free

name: Camp & shop
description: Camping space right down the road from Lidl and Mercadona. Just drive down the hill from Lidl, go between the big containers, there's perfect asfalt with a nice view. Reasonably private and road noise is acceptable. Perfect for catching the ferry next day.

name: View on Santa Cruz de La Palma
description: Forest road 150 m from the main road with a flat spot for one vehicle. Another spot 50m down the road. Nice view at 1500m on Santa Cruz. Reasonable 4G. Not too difficult offroad, probably doable with a small van.

name: Sa Canterella Restaurant
description: Nice small campground with toiletts and swimmingpool running by a restaurant. Place for 8 motorhomes not longer than 7 meter. Free, but it seems that it is expected that you have lunch or dinner there.

name: Wild camp in a small Pine forest
description:
Just 200m away from the main of road (Camino de Santiago). 
Clean. Quite. No water but the last village it is just 2,5 km away from here.

name: Near road
description: Around 1 km from the main road. Quiet and clean. Well protected by some trees.

name: Offroad -Tenerife
description:
This location point is the entry road to a 1 square km area perfect for offroading and camping. I spent 10 nights there in 6 different locations, from pebble beach to green valleys to hill tops. Absolutely 4x4 as the roads are rough. There is an alternative entry to the area from the village of La Mareta, with some easy camping near the beach that is accessible for any car.
From the location point drive through the tunnel under the motorway and left up, then use Google satellite image to see all the off road tracks. Don't drive here after dark.
Leave the place better than you found it and enjoy the best wild camping spot on Tenerife.

name: La vega
description: Very remote spot at the end of a track. Quiet night warranted. Steep descent on the last 100 meters, 4WD with short gears mandatory.

name: Refugio Cárdena
description: Really Tough coming up from Ribadelago Nuevo. Be well prepared physically and mentally. 4.6 km in 5:30 hours. My bike was 40 kg.

name: Pine land
description: Quite and wood to build a fire (if is not too windy).

name: Zona de Autocaravanas y Campers
description:
Good views of the marsh. Fill water tanks and empty gray and black water. Electricity. In the town, there are all services 
Buenas vistas al pantano. LLenar tanques de agua y vaciar aguas grises y negras. Electricidad. En el pueblo, hay de todos los servicios

name: Fajana
description: Very nice place directly at the coast. Waves, Lighthouse, two restaurants nearby. Room for 20 Campers, mostly empty. Good mobile connection.

name: Fontanilla
description: Big area with lots of wildcamping options. Acces road in bad condition but drivable with any vehicle. With 4x4 you can drive right up to the cliff edge for amazing views, but 2x4 have many options between the trees. Acces to the beach and a beach bar via some steep pathways. No trash bins so lots of trash laying around. Please take some with you when you drive out and let's leave this place better than we found it, otherwise we are going to loose acces to these kind of places in the future. Can get busy in the weekends.

name: El Fondo
description: Large parking lot at the natural park El Fondo. Overnight stays are allowed. Very quiet at night, pretty dark. The park is great for bird watchers. Nice walks or bicycle rides. No shade. Flat gravel. The visitors center is 200 meters away and you will find toilets that are open 24/7 and a water tap.

name: Elburgo
description: Nice big camper parking in front of the lake. Very calm.

name: Playa las Lances
description: Long parking stretch right next to the beach. Camping Vans are allowed to spend the night during Winter Low Season month. After Easter the Police is chasing overnighters away. Winterseason only. They seem to install height restricting bars currently to restrict RV access. Check before entering.

name: Near Gulfar
description: Quiet and clean. Some private houses not far from here.

name: Carcastillo
description: Campsite in the country nex to Aragon river.

name: Near bridge
description: large parking spot next to broken old bridge. very quiet.

name: Caravanas Papiol
description: Our parking for caravans, campers and motorhome is 15 minutes driving to the downtown of Barcelona.

name: Pajarero wild camp
description: Flat place in wild nature. Nice for cyclists, vans and motorbikes. Possible to find water (not safe for drinking, 100 metres east from the flat place).

name: Area recreativa Los Paules
description: Recreational area with parking lot, stone tables and a fresh water tap

name: Bolonia Beach Parking
description: Large public parking area that belongs to the archeological site next to the beach.

name: Gorafe 4x4 river camp
description: Deep into the Gorafe park. Big flat camp next to a little river. Road goes on if you cross the river but 4x4 is necessary. River crossing to the east is also possible, but a few km further is blocked by a gate. No cell phone reception. Use satellite images to get here. Amazing acces road from Gorafe village, highly recommended. 5 stars!

name: Gabo de Gata beach parking
description: Large public parking lot next to the beach. Some restaurants and bars close by. Has garbage disposal. Can be busy during weekends or high season.

name: Albergue de Calarreona
description: Cheap and nice hostel next to the sea. Private rooms with shower, toilet and air conditioning. Common room with microwave and fridge. Parking. Price: 12'40 € pppn. Phone to reserve in summer and spanish holidays.

name: Sound of the bees🐝
description: Very quiet place, surrounded by fields & mountains. Very private with only the sound of bees from the hives 100m further. Good cell service 4G. Nice for walking. More camp spots nearby. No entry with vehicles in the Sierra del Carche. 700 meters high, acces via good dirt road (but can get slippery after rain).

name: Stunning lake views
description: Amazing place with several camp options. Cliff jumping, swimming, fishing easy access to the water. Last camp spots require 4x4, but acces road is easy (though a high tunnel). Very limited phone service. Keep this place clean please!

name: La Muntanya gamping
description: GAMPING LA MUNTANYA, is a valley of fruit trees and abundant vegetation, with a stone wall worked by hand and of great size and value. Waking up in the middle of nature, calm, the sound of animals, .... They make this environment a place of disconnection, and exceptional wild camping

name: Cascading river *offroad*
description: A short but rather technical dirt road gets you down to a cool site next to a little cascading river. Big flat grassy area with minimum road noise and just enough 4G. Nice walks left and right. 4x4 or enduro bike only.

name: Lourdes, Santuario
description:
Very well level parking, asphalt floor, very close village, free, WC next to the convent. Base for hiking in the middle of nature.
.....
Parquing muy bien nivelado, suelo de asfalto, pueblo muy cerca, gratuito, WC al lado del convento. Base para caminatas en plena naturaleza.

name: Wild Watertank Camp
description: Fireroad campsite next to a watertank on top of the hill. No nothing exept a stunning nature and a watertank. Road was a bit dodgy, but made it with a 7m long and 3m high van.

name: El Bruc
description:
Truck stop with free shower. Go to the cafeteria (not the gas station) and ask for the key for the showers (they speak English). They will want your keys from your 'truck' in exchange.
Clean, big warm shower.

name: Beautiful rural spot halfway between Conil and Cabo de Trafalgar
description: Very quiet rural spot, a 7 minutes walk to a gorgeous beach, nudist if you’re into that. Birds, dark starry nights, a farm with thoroughbred horses. Clean. To find: at the end of the road, where it reads “salida”, turn left. One spot only on the right side of the road next to the large stones. Nice meadow behind. Plenty of firewood on the beach

name: Mountainview picnic
description:
Very charming picnic place with stunning views. Big level parking space 100m before the actual picnic area with benches, bbq's, water (toilet was closed in May)and adventure park with tree-walks. Surrounding area has little waterfalls and amazing walking routes.
At 1640m so might get cold at night and probably busy in summer /weekends. Cellphone service 4G.

name: Puerto Blanco
description: Right next to Puerto Blanco beach.This is an abandoned( out of service ) little Harbor where you can sleep. The police use to make a round to check everything is in order.They saw our rooftop tents opened and didn't said anything.

name: Fang Aventura
description: Large farm and activities centre (paintball, quads, etc) with many different spaces for camping.  Free, you can leave something for the property if you wish.

name: Castell de Mur
description: Very nice view, close to the main road, beginning of the road is stiff and Rocky. OK with a short van and good Tyre.

name: Near Beach
description: Nice spot under the trees, just behind the beach. Now and then a jogger or someone with a dog comes by. Light traffic noise, sound of the surf, birds. No one around, may be different in weekends. Great beach!

name: Camping Area
description: Water at the dump station of a free camp site for motorhomes.

name: Motorhome campsite
description: equipped with water and dump station for free. you can have electricity, but you have to pay for it

name: Dinosaurs footprints
description:
Lots of nice places on this road and in the area, with dinosaurs footprints and explication boards.
Steep roads!

name: Roadside
description:
vey nice dry camping spot. overlooking the valley.
very quiet. far from everything. nice sunsets.
really worth it!

name: Lake border
description: no noise, beautiful setting, large area for many rigs

name: Spring water
description:
spring water running permanently from a water tap on a large parking place.
Sign says: 'water untreated' but locals come here to fill their bottles

name: Parking Lot
description:
asphalted public parking lot, with grass spots for those who prefer.
surrounded by snowy top mountains and waterfalls. lots of trekking possibilities. water accessible at the river nearby. peaceful night
great place!
Tents are not allowed and dogs must be maintained with a leash.

name: nice spots by the river
description:
many spots for any size of rig, on a dirt road just by the river.
beware the flow of the river can change drastically in short laps of time, it can be dangerous.
mild cell phone connection

name: nice waterfall
description:
inicio senda cascada is a good looking waterfall in a rocky Valley. 
just park here the walk up the river to find it
just 10 or 15 minutes walk

name: beautiful lake view
description:
nice free spot above the lake, surrounded by the mountains. great view.
large place on the side of a tiny road, so very few traffic. 
Space for many vehicles, but not everything is leveled.

name: Caseres
description: There is a zone of BBQ next to the zone of camping. You have the Algars River next to the site.

name: Cuevas Andalucia
description:
You are looking for an original rental, you have a desire for escape, freedom, travel, dreaming and encounters?
An original outing with family or with friends in a romantic setting?
On a property of 8 hectares with a swimming pool heated in winter, come and relax while listening to the silence.
Set in rural country terrain renowned for it's cave dwellings, these cave houses have been beautifully restored to an exceptional standard and include all of the 21st century conveniences expected by today's high living standards. 
Our Spanish cave house properties are ready-to let, ready-to-live-in yet uniquely different whether they have 1,2 or 3-bedrooms.
So if rural Spain is where you want to holiday or live, our cave houses are a must see. 
Just a five minute stroll from a typical Andalucian village (Baza) with its local amenities and 60 minutes from the grandiose city of Granada and airport, this truly is Real Life Spain!
“Aurôre and Sam” will be pleased to welcome you in the historic south of Spain, in the heart of Eastern Andalusia in an area still free from intensive tourism and close to Granada. 
Our lodgings are equipped with solar panels for domestic hot water as well as for warm water for the swimming pool in winter and this in order to guarantee a comfortable low cost energy for our customers during their stay. 

By our activity, we also want to show that it is possible to have alternative ways to live with respect for the environment by quite simply using alternative energies and the comfort of a cueva (troglodyte house) with next to no ecological footprints
Try the troglodyte dwellings of Baza close to the road Ibn Al-Jatib, the natur al reserves of the Sierra of Baza, Pozo and of Cazorla, the Alhambra, the Sierra Nevada, the Negratín dam, the museum of Orce, the preserved beach of Gabo de Gata. 

While being close to nature and quietness, you enjoy the comfort of an ecological cueva enhanced by solar panels for hot water and a natural air-conditioning all year round (18 to 22°C).
At our place tourism is different... 
A mixture of disparate and authentic things which make life worth living!
Welcomed in this unusual land, you will benefit from a most refined stay, the vastness of the sky and the softness of the Andalusian nights.
It is also possible to install your tent, your caravan or motorhome on the vast property in order to limit your lodging expenses.
For the amateurs of coasting flight, parapente, delta, we are at 10 minutes away from Jabalcon, a must for carrying out splendid flights!
It is also possible to practise climbing, mountain-biking, swimming, water sports, canyoning and walking.

name: Top of a Hill
description: It's not really able to place a tent, but neither impossdible. Better with a Camper. It's a stoney path you can get from the CV 133. It's nearly noiceless and peacefully, with a great sigth other the mountains. Check it Out

name: Santander RV park
description: Santander motorhome Area. Free parking for RV with fresh water and dump station. Nice place behind a park and the university

name: Camping Naturista Almanat
description: FKK NATURIST campsite, with all services, toilets, hot showers, electricity, bungalows, outdoor pool, heated pool, sauna, barbecue area, children's park, miniature golf, bar, restaurant. Water and electricity in all pitches. Lots of shade, very calm and quiet environment, it has direct access to the naturist beach of Almayate. An ideal place for the whole family IF YOU LIKE TO BE NAKED in contact with nature. I´m not sure if it's "Big Rig" friendly but I have seen some really big pitches at the campsite, although it's best to ask first by phone.

name: Peñas de Aya
description: À litre mountain in the middle of a Valley

name: Samieira
description:
2 euros per night, lovely place with sea views and shade, views of the estuary of Pontevedra, very cozy.
.....
2 euros noche , lugar encantador con vistas al mar y sombra , vistas a la ría de pontevedra , muy acogedor.

name: Roses
description: Free parking.  You can sleep, but without taking out chairs and a table.

name: Gorliz Camping
description: Big and nice camp-site, offering also restaurant and small shop. We have paid 30 EUR for car with roof top tent and 2+2 people.

name: Loredo Camping
description: Not too bad site but not the cheapest. Close to the beach.

name: At the river
description: Nice spot next to the river. Also some tables and seats. Will fit few cars, campers.

name: Costa Verde Camp
description: Nice camping and well maintained. 50m to the beach. Good for the long and short rest.

name: Beach Spot
description: Another beautiful beach. Very quiet and great view. It has shower. The spot is big enough for camper vans and smaller cars.

name: Sant Gregori
description:
I live in a house with my family surrounded by a large forest. It is a nice, quiet and beautiful place. 

We have a dog and two horses, your animals are welcome.

It is close to the center of the city of Girona by car (10 'approx) and near the town of Sant Gregori (3' by car, and less than 1 hour walking through nature).

The area is easily accessible. It is flat and it is shaded because it is under the trees. Next to it is an open, treeless, and sunny area, which can also be used.

There is a bathroom to use, with a shower as well.
We have free and open wifi for guests.
In case you need electricity, we provide an extension cord. We also provide water.

Here you can go hiking or cycling, surrounded by forest and nature.

A motorhome fits comfortably, not larger vehicles.

*The price per night is 12€ for one person, 17€ for two people, 20€ three or more*

name: Riverside camp (4WD only)
description: A few kilometers from the E80 highway south of Burgos, close to a village called Pampliega, there is the Rio Arlanzón. This particular spot is along this river river in a forest. I reckon there are more spots like this around in this area. Really nobody there, just the wind in the trees and a buzzard lady flying over and whatching... To get to the spot you need to take some farmer's tracks through the fields, they are rather 4WD only.

name: Castrelo de Miño
description: Big reats area next to the lake. Not many people staying for a night when we have been here. Tab water avaible, grils, tables and seats as well. Easy access to the lake.

name: Perfect rest.
description: Great reast area with free swimming pool and lovely restaurant. We staid here for a night as there is some place to park. We are traveling with roof top tent.

name: Camping Villa de Iruelas
description:
Located in the heart of the Nature Reserve, a place where we can rest and walk. From the campsite there are different botanical paths or to the viewpoint of vultures. In a spectacular environment of a high ecological value, you can find the facilities of our Campsite. Located on the north face of Gredos and at the foot of the Burguillo reservoir you can experience multiple activities such as hiking, canoeing, horses, nautical and many more. Nice and secluded spot. Showers and toilets are clean and acceptable. The swimming pool may get crowded over the weekend but overall it´s more than OK.
.....
Situado en el corazón de la Reserva Natural, lugar privilegiado donde podemos descansar y pasear. Desde el camping existen diferentes sendas botánicas o al mirador de los buitres. En un entorno espectacular de un alto valor ecológico podrá encontrar las instalaciones de nuestro Camping. Situado en la cara norte de Gredos y a los pies del embalse del Burguillo podrás experimentar múltiples actividades tales como senderismo, piragüismo, caballos, náutica y muchas más.

name: Free designated campsite Las Acebeas
description: Designated campsite installed by the national park authorities. There are benches, toilets and water but all seems to be locked up out of season. There is a little stream running trough the grounds. On the middle of a beautiful forest. A few hikikg trails start here. Free.

name: Free campsite Bayarcal
description: A campsite that isn’t a campsite… a municipial area “for everybody”, mostly aimed at children camps. There is also a pretty spectacular tyrolien across the valley. Free to camp, good foor rtt and regular tents too. Great views and very calm at night. During the day children camp activities. No real campsite facilities, but there are clean toilets and a restaurant/bar. Probably only open during season? They lock the place at night, so you are locked up :-)

name: Llano escondido
description:
Small esplanade next to the road. It is hidden by some trees. There is a small descent that can be difficult for a van, better in 4x4 although it could.

Pequeña esplanada al lado del camino. Queda escondido por unos arboles. Hay una pequeña bajada que puede ser complicado para una furgoneta, mejor en 4x4 aunque se podria.

name: El Torcón
description: Nice picnic and camping area with drinking water. No toilets. It seems that to camp permission should be asked in the next village (Hortigüela), but just for one night it looks like nobody is going to care. Camped here in july 2021. Quite a few people camping, tents and cars but quiet atmosphere.

name: Camping Refugio de Pescadores
description: Nice, shady and grassy municipal campsite among pine trees. Clean and well mantained facilities. No restaurant and just a few basic groceries sold at reception. The town, Covaleda, is nearby. Arrived by bicycle and paid 7,80 (1 person, 1 tent).

name: Tavernas desert spot
description:
You enter like you are going to mini-Hollywood and there is a small road actually going to the desert. 5 min and you will know where to stop. 
You have a magnificent view over the desert and sunset is one of the most incredible I’ve seen. 
Warm even at night during summer, gets cold after sun down. 
You can camp easily and no one will bother.

name: barrage ruesta
description:
Really a so nice spot, nice view on the lake and the mountain, beautiful view and beautiful spot
Large place under the tree, not far from water.
You can swim, the water is clear and hot.
Higly recommended
Only for van and 4x4

name: Montederramo
description:
So nice place, next to the river, with barbecue, with child's air game, with trash, at 1,5 km from center of the village.
Place for many vehicles under shadows, and access for all vehicles. 
Really quite on week, but in the week-end local people enjoy this place too.

name: Fuente Baterna. Zarzosa
description:
NOTE: No vehicular access!

This nice place with picnic tables and a fountain is perfect for one night camping. Next to the road and partialy visible from it, but no evident. The place is enclosed to avoid animals getting it, and it is accessible only on foot or by bicycle. Camped here and saw nobody. The area is remote and the village, Zarzosa, is the last one on the road. Probably, you will only come here if you are walking or cycling between Zarzosa and Vadillos (beautiful and steep). Just a little further up, there is a forest church with another picnic area and gravel road access.

name: La Rosina Ecovillage
description: La Rosina Ecovillage is an ecovillage project and headquarters of 2 associations. We lodge people , serve vegan meals, hosts volunteers and organize events.

name: public cold shower
description: As described a public cold shower. Nada mas

name: Countryside
description:
Large area in the countryside with great views, offering peace and tranquility and a safe and legal place to park up for the night or longer. Friendly owners on site to help with any advice on the many activities in the local area. Popular tourist area for its beautiful countryside, rivers, lakes, waterfalls, wild swimming, many watersports on the local reservoir, hiking and cycling routes, many outdoor sports and activities also close by.
We provide free WIFI in certain areas and water and flat land for you to make yourself at home. Suitable for self sufficient campers and motorhomes. Very pet friendly - pet babysitting services offered also!

name: Wild Camping beside Lake(Embalse) De Mediano
description:
Many nice and flat places near the lake.
Some places with shadow.
Beautiful views from mountain and lake.

name: Camping at Río Sinca
description:
Little hidden spot 20meters from the river.
Fits 2 or 3 small cars.
Flat but with weed and dust.
Near the road bu quiet at night.
Wonderful view from the mountains and perfect to swim and enjoy the clear water.

name: Punta de La Pixerota
description:
Just 100 meters before the beach.
At the right side of the street is a nice and flat place in the middle of the olive trees.
Good for campers, vans and rooftent like us. Quiet and clean.
There is a restaurant at the beach and a shower also.

name: Parking lot Usurbil
description: Quiet parking lot with no facilities. We stayed one night and it was okay.

name: Former Campamento La Salle
description: Perfect wild campsite if you are cycling or walking the old "Vasco-Navarro" railroad greenway. Flat, clean and grassy explanade. There is a shelter too. You can access easily the river for water (or a bath).

name: Finestras
description: Nice place for wild camping near astonishing Finestras. very quiet. no utilities. rough road to access to Finestras. the site is 50m of the road. 4x4 only

name: Enguidanos
description: Nice platform near the forest road. Perfect for a night stop on this rough road. 4x4 only.

name: Between Burriana and Nules
description:
A nice coast and shore. We camped with our rooftent just on the Rocky beach. There are some other spots around.
Locals come to have a bath in the little and nice closed beach.
No shade.
Please leave the place clean. Don't litter like we saw some locals do.
Let's take care of our planet.

name: Just on the Playa del Xarco
description:
You have to take a dust road from El Carabassot. 5km west after the hills. The road is not so good, but even in high season only a few people on the beach.
We parked our car with rooftent just at the mast of a flag.

name: Free Camping at Playa de La Chapineta
description:
Very big place where campers can overnigh for free.
50 meters from the beach. Many parking spots for big or small rigs.
There is a supermarket Spar and some restaurants. On the beach some facilities. Blue Flag beach.

name: Cepsa o Corgo
description: Gas station with parking for motorhomes (on both sides of the Road). With black water discharging, shower, restaurante.

name: Cubla
description: Nice plateform with an amazing view at the end of a rough road. 4x4 only

name: Wild Camping at Playa Villaricos
description:
Some nice and hidden spots just on the beach.
There is a big parking lot where you can camp also. But we wanted some privacy so 50 meters in front some nice natural pools from the ocean.

name: Playa El Egido - Almerimar
description:
Couple kilometers from the center, a big place to camp and park overnight.
Showers but no shade.
Quiet at night

name: Big flat place near a huge Eucaliptus Tree
description:
Big place around this beautiful tree at Costa del Sol.
100 meters from the beach where are some amenities like restaurants and shower.

name: Parking and Sleeping at Playa de La Chullera
description:
It's a big parking lot near the beach.
During the day several cars and people going to the beach.
At night we opened our rooftent and slept very well.
Couple of RVs used this place also to pass the night.

name: Calleja motos
description: Good place for spare parts, also a little workshop and another shop selling clothing and accessories, all the same business, but spread over three shops

name: By the dam
description: Enter where the recreational area is and turn right once you get down to the water, couple of nice spots along the edge, out of sight. Little bit of road noise. Weak 3G signal

name: Coruña del Conde
description:
Nice spot by the river to overnight, next to a fountain, with some tree shadows and a picnic zone. There is also a built bbq where you can make fire to cook if not in summer (to avoid risk of forest fire). 
This place is located near a house, so you must be very very respectful and quiet.
The entrance to this spot is done by a slope not recommended for low profile vehicles. Much better if you are on a 4x4 with lifted suspension.

name: Pinar de La Barrosa
description:
It's a public parking place within the woods.
We talked to the Police just in front of the car park and they said it's OK to sleep 1 night here.

There are public restrooms.

name: Isabena Campsite
description: Super relaxed campsite, mainly occupied with off-road enthusiasts; both on motorbike and 4x4. They also have a nice restaurant and swimming pool. Next to this it is also a BMW Motorrad test drive center, so you can try several bikes for a reasonable price. But the best thing is, they also own Enduro Park Isabena where you can do off-road motorcycle trainings. They can also organize multiple day guided off-road tours in the Pyrenees. In short, a very relaxed place!

name: AFTER OPASSA
description: 3x Paces , Marvelious panorama. Also 7.m. Camper high on the Pyrenees

name: Collada de can nou
description: Flat spot where to camp next to the trail. you can fit up to 6 or 8 cars. The access from Sadernes is very narrow and requires a 4x4.

name: Wander Parkplatz
description: a small place near the road but not much traffic and quiet at night.

name: In the woods with view in teide
description: At the end of a dirt road. Only smart rigs fit. Use maps me to navigate. I came here by entering from TF373 but I’m sure there are multiple entries. No people and nice view on teide. Shed off from wind

name: lac La Viñuela,  Espagne
description: smart place close the lac. for small vehicle. Attention in case of rain.

name: Ermita de San Antonio
description:
On the dirt road leading to the "Albergue de Montfalcó" from the town of Viacamp is this picnic area with wooden tables and stools. Surrounded by cork oaks and some olive trees. In addition to the Hermitage there is an abandoned and ruined farmhouse, which is where you can park well, the area is flat, about 20x30 meters. There are no signs that prohibit overnight stays. There is a cell tower nearby, with Vodafone 4G and 4G / LTE coverage at full throttle.
I'm not sure if Big Rigs will go to the flat area because there is a curve past the Hermitage with trees somewhat narrow. I usually enter with a 6.40 meter motorhome and scratch a branch but nothing serious.

name: Campersite Santa Pau
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Image translations  "it is forbidden to unfold the awning. forbidden to take tables outside. To camp You must go to the campsites of the municipality that are in this central zone of the natural park."

Big field for campers, reasonable level. No amenities but walking distance to the ancient town center. ‘Camping’ not allowed, meaning no awnings or full setup. 
Food truck nearby as well as multiple restaurants in the town.

name: Sant Alís/Montsec
description:
Old paragliding take-off area. The dirt road is uncomplicated but there are sections of loose stones. It is not a very flat area but the vehicle can be leveled well.
The views are spectacular, both day and night.
4G mobile coverage (Vodafone)

name: Saldropo humedal
description: PickNick area with Playground for kids and water

name: Oversized vehicle parking
description:
Parking is expensive but will accept vehicles up to 2.9m high. 
They also have 2 spots for event taller rigs. 
Next to a metro station to get you downtown very easily

name: Eneperi
description: Parking with great views and bathrooms. Easy to find, very quiet. There is a sign forbidden caravans and buses but nobody comes…

name: Yellow Van panoramic Place
description: Great place with great panoramic views. Flat meadow place for some cars and tents. A old yellow van is here as a landmarker therefore the name. The gravel road is very bumpy and high clearence makes everything easier.

name: Spring Water
description: So fresh, so cool and with good pressure, filled our 60l tank within minutes

name: Castro de las Cogotas
description: Near the archeological site of Castro de las Cogotas: flat spot by the reservoir, sandy beach and rocks. A few fishermen by day, quiet at night. Bring your own firewood. Good 4G signal

name: Mountain Views
description:
A spot by the road, for people to take a photo of a picturesque view. There is one more spot like this, about 1 km closer to France, but forgot to geotag it.

No doubt, there are more spots but I liked these two.

name: CamperStop Alegría
description:
A campground at the country side of Extremadura. This campground is especially for motorhomes and vans. 20 available spots. Parking in shade possible. 
Electricity, showers and toilets (they are finishing them right now, because they just opened). 
Village (Montánchez) with restaurants and a supermarket in walking distance

name: Close to Hoces del Rio Duratón
description: Flat ground between pine trees, next to farmland. Close to the national park, where camping is not permitted; here it is ok. No facilities. Good 4G signal. Good acces to hikes along the cliffs; not sure if you can hike to the river

name: Cobos de Fuentidueña
description: Watertap on town square. Not easy to write at least forty caracters about a tap

name: Camping Artaza-Urederra
description:
Moderator Note: Please note the closure dates as reported by a User.
.....
Nice and calm camping away from the roads with excellent views on the mountains. Close to the Urederra natural park.

name: L'Hospoitale de l'Infant
description: Free WiFi, also a restaurant/ toilets/ petrol station.

name: Free Camping at Extremadura
description:
A big parking lot for Motorhomes and all kinds of vehicles.
It was a restaurant here, buts closed.
Just 5 or 6 km from the border with Portugal.
Nice mountains to climb just 500 M from here.
Also a dumping station, but not working.
Many picnic tables and benches. Shade and flat place.
No water or toilet available.

name: Beside Tejo River Near Salto del Girano
description:
A nice and quiet place. You take a short dirty road for 400m from the main road.
Many picnic tables and benches.
Nice view.
At night we were visited by herd of dears. Wonderful!
Keep this nice place clean. Don't feed the animals. There is a fountain with potable water. Fuente del Francés

name: Mirador La Galiana
description:
Nice place to sleep.
Parking lot and a good place just beside.
You can view the "buitres" - cóndor, from here.
Please keep the place clean.
Use the trash can.

name: Ermita Valdehierro
description:
Free camping area in the Sierra de Madridejos, a very quiet place in the middle of nature.  BBQ area and many trails, nearby there is a natural spring
===
Zona de acampada libre en la sierra de Madridejos, sitio muy tranquilo en medio de la naturaleza. Zona de barbacoas y muchos senderos, cerca hay un manantial natural

name: Negratín viewpoint parking
description: After the parking of a viewpoint of the Negratín, you can take an exit to a random village (The signal says it is 4km far). After 1km you can see the spot on your left, just behind/under the main road.

name: Parking Safont
description:
parking in the city of Toledo, 2km from the old town.  Very quiet place.
.....
Aparcamiento en la ciudad de Toledo, a 2km del casco viejo. Sitio muy tranquilo.

name: Parkingplace in Cerler
description: A very large parking place- for RV / Motorhomes - at night very quiet

name: Queralbs car park
description:
Free mobile home parking space at Queralbs.
No supply or disposal.

name: Alora spain
description: Great parking lot with dump and fresh water

name: Área Recreativa
description:
Camped here,very quiet,water portable,plenty of space.
2 km from Cofrentes which has a grocery store.
4G!

name: Los Villares Domus Beticae Cordoba 14029
description: Pitches for camper vans and tents. Toilet clean and in good order. Electric at the pitches, small shop with bar and restaurant only open weekends out of season. 1 x tent motorcycle and person is €18 per night. All pitches are in the shade as it’s situated in a wooded area. Outdoor swimming pool. Staff very friendly and helpful.

name: Los Arenales
description: Large camping ground, with bar and restaurant. Water and electricity points on most of the pitches. Open all year round. Clean washing facilities. Hot water. Pitches are in the shade of trees. Only a kilometer from town.

name: Overlook Punta Gaubieta
description: Large overlook pull off that has a beautiful view at sunset! There were several campers here when I found it. No services but the cell reception seems good.

name: Commune Beneficio
description:
Come and see for yourself!
Even though the parking might appear full of odd dropouts with all sorts of drugs around it is super safe and quiet at night! The parking acts like a barrier to protect the commune that sits in the hills and the forest above.

name: Río Atika
description: Río Atika, cerca de La Pobla de Lillet. Place to spend the night.  Road with almost no traffic.  The river has a backwater to cool off.

name: Embarcador Ginestar
description:
Place with 4 parking spaces where it is possible to sleep one night, always discreet. 
 It is next to the jetty of the river Ebro.

name: Ermita El Calvari
description: Here is a fountain with drinking water. In the surroundings, there are some more.

name: Puerta del Campo, Granja-Escuela
description: Large, flat place in a beautiful, rural and quiet environment. Price € 10 for 24 hours per vehicle. Shower € 2 px.

name: Camping Punta del Hidalgo
description:
Vehicle reception hours: (09:00 to 14.00) & (16:00 to 18:30)
you need to book in advance

name: Parking club Náutico Sevilla
description: This is a large parking area that appears to be free and there are lots of other campers here. No facilities, but well lit and safe. Very near all the sights!

name: Old playground
description: A great spot for a night, well above the motorway but still audible but ok. Great views and flat. Good 4G signal. Apparently there is a fresh spring near. Good view of the mountains.

name: Very old section of road
description: This is a beautiful spot to camp. It's an old section of road with a picnic place with bins and tables. You can hear the highway on the background but it's not an issue. There is a really old bridge too.

name: Spring on hillside
description: An amazing fast flowing spring. Many locals go there to fill their drinking water. Water is safe.

name: via verde Terra Alta
description: Nice little spot next to the Via Verde. We spend a night on our bicycle tour

name: Mirador camping spot
description: A pretty amazing little spot. We were there in winter and it was very very quiet. Amazing views. No services but good 4g signal.

name: Fuente de San Lorenzo
description: Many locals stopped whilst I was here to drink and fill bottles. They all said it was the best water around.  So I filled up too.

name: Source of the Rio Tajo
description: This is a wonderful place, quiet with large flat parking area. We were there in Autumn and there were no other people. Might be different in Summer. There are Fuentes for water. No mobile signal.

name: Great spot next to very quiet road
description: A beautiful spot ok for a night next to some walking routes and a quiet road. No services but good mobile signal and lovely view.

name: My car has been broken into here
description: Be careful here! We stayed at this parking for three nights. All good; then the window was smashed. Everything pulled out in the rain and drenched. I can't recommend the place after this incident. But vandalism and broken cars are a huge problem all over the city. Very sad  be safe put there

name: old chapel
description: spooky in a clear full moon night but hopefully worth the goosebumps

name: Sant Martí de Montenegre
description: A parking spot with a nice view for sunset and sunrise. Nearby is a restaurant, but was closed when I was there. It's a good starting point if you want to do some offroading in the mountains. The access road to the spot is gravel road and I saw a bunch of normal 2WD cars, but the road is washed out at some points.

name: Náquera
description:
Place is called la cantina.
Verry good food and nice people who talk a bit of english too

name: Water tap in petrol station
description: Petrol station where you can fill your water tank. It takes loooong time because low presure in pipes.

name: Drinking water tap
description: Just a normal water tap. Drinking quality!

name: Silent place by water
description: Good place by the water and a lot of space.

name: Ambolo cliffs
description:
Ambolo cliffs mirador just outside the door, great climbing area with board for difficulty grades. 

Just at the end of the road there is enough space to turn around even with a 6m motorhome. People come and go during the day, but nobody cares about us camping here as this is a super rich villa neighborhood. Supermarket to far.

name: Better altenative for Ondarra/La Arena
description: Better alternative for Ondarra/La Arena. Large gravel parking area, with at the end a path to a smaller area with an absolutely epic view. Don’t know if its legal or not, no signs seen.

name: Camper Service
description: Dumping station for grey water. Fresh (slightly chlorinated) water available, too

name: Camping Parque Tropical
description: Camp site for motor homes a few kilometer from the Center of Estepona

name: Sunny spot at the lake
description:
Nice place at the lake. We got here because the second spot at the lake (which is very nice) had no sun a long time of the day (in winter).
Watch out for the water level changes!

name: San Isidro area
description: Quiet place. 40 kms from Albacete city. Flat place. Tables and public roof for tents. Free water in the public white building.

name: Playa de la Canteria
description: Near the Playa de la Canteria, in Orzola, various spots where you can park and stay the night. Orzola is near and you can find restaurants, bars, a little supermarket.

name: Embalse de Forata
description:
There’s a nice little spot down by the lake. Space for one a two vans. Few other little spots a little further up. 
The road down is pretty bumpy, I could make it without 4x4 but you wanna have some clearance. 
The spot is very quiet and secluded. Unfortunately pretty much garbage around.

name: Lebaña camperspot
description: Camper area with amazing view, in the middle of Picos de Europa. Includes toilet and sink, containers for waste. Very good spot.

name: La Naturaleza
description: This is quite a large, rambling sort of place. A bit dilapidated but that has it's own charm. Our pitch didn't have any facilities but I think there are others with water and electricity. The communal toilet block is very clean. This is a useful base for exploring a pretty isolated area of Spain but don't expect too many creature comforts.

name: Water tap
description: Good pressure drinking water tap. Close by the highway.

name: Algeciras
description: Auto gas, propane butane. Fill Your vehicle with auto gas.

name: Punta de Canales
description:
To find this place you will have to leave the N340 at km 96 and follow that gravel road about 3km downhill passing through an abandoned military post. (Don't worry no more military there), At the end there is the possibility to park your car. Beach is pebbles, the rocks are good to go snorkeling: 

Cellphone availability only through the Moroccan net. 
No water, no shops.

name: Tentspot bike or hike
description: Next to the road is a little trail some meters down. A flat space with great view on the valley. Perfect for cyclists or hikers. Take a check on the wind, bc it’s very open.

name: Puerto de PuntaGorda
description: 20 min drive down initially Camino del Cementario (which turns into Camino del Puerto) on an asphalt just wider than single track road with switchbacks.  Go past the reservoir (on right hand side) and and follow the asphalt road so the sea is on your right.  Follow signs for “el Puerto” (the port) and down to the end of the road - where there is a natural seawater swimming pool - down a flight of 500 steps at the end!  You go past a whole community of places built into the rock down the steps along the way.  This is NOT a port but it is a special place to enjoy.   You can walk from PuntaGorda but takes about 2 hours downhill.

name: Tent site
description: A great spot for tents that is totally hidden from the road and protected from most winds as well.

name: Dry creek bed
description: Go “upstream” in the dry creek bed from the road. Once around the bend there is a flat area big enough for a tent up against the side of the creek bank. Totally hidden from the road. You may have to move some rocks around a bit to fit your tent.

name: Dry creek bed
description: Go up the dry creek bed a little ways until you are hidden from the road. Not a lot of options but you can make it work for sure.

name: Water spring
description: Potable water near town centre. Good drinking quality!

name: Serpac4x4
description:
A Good Workshop specialized in 4x4 but also helped me with my Honda CR-V. Very helpful and doing a good job!
One of the two brothers even speaks a little English which is a big plus!

name: Dry creek tent site
description: The coordinates are for the entrance, not the actual site. From the coordinates look to the west side of the road. You will see a two track road that more or less goes straight up a small hill (see photo). Follow this two track up the valley for a couple minutes and you will see two boxes that look like they were once used for a scientific animal study. Just a few meters from these boxes is a small dry creek bed perfect for a tent.

name: Jalance
description: Free parking for 48 hrs and water servicing. It’s located at very nice village with its Castell.

name: Ermita Nuestra Señora de la Cabeza
description: Mountain church. Flat place for campervans and trucks. Also possible to pitch a tent (just ask the person living there) water, tables and wc. Weekend is more populated.

name: La duna
description:
Great little place! Greasy croissants, homemade quiche and focaccia and salads, pizzas..
Fresh juices and very friendly owner and staff.. right on the boardwalk in el Medano

name: Cool cave nr Faro
description:
Near Faro, settlement in an old lava tube. Steps lead down to a cool little cave that you can walk for a few minutes down. Take a torch or have your phone handy. Not in any guide books that we’ve seen.
Enjoy!

name: Mirador de la Peña
description:
Wonderful viewpoint over the whole El Golfo on a clear day!
a restaurant is here - even open during Covid times! Food looked nice but we only stopped in for a hot drink and a quesadilla. Very welcoming. Small shop as well.

name: Bees Overlander and Motorhome Service
description:
With our fully equipped workshop and years of experience we offer any repairs in- and outside your overlander or motorhome habitat. Replace windows, fix water pumps, change hinges, install solar panels or whatever it will be. As we are building our own Overlander we are also happy to chat with a coffee. We do not repair mechanical parts of your car, but know some very good and cheap workshops. 

You can use our adress as a shipping adress for e.g. Amazon. But we can also provide translation assistance or assistance in hospitals / medical centres. We have been the contact for medical emergencies on cruise ships in the region for several years. We know that in such situations it can be very difficult to cope in a country you don't know like your own. 
As we have lived in Spain for 15 years and speak English and French as well as Spanish, we are prepared for many situations. 
__________________________

Avec notre garage entièrement équipé et nos années d'expérience, nous proposons toutes les réparations à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur de votre habitat overlander ou camping-car. Remplacer les fenêtres, réparer les pompes à eau, changer les charnières, installer des panneaux solaires ou autre. Comme nous construisons notre propre Overlander, nous sommes également heureux de discuter avec un café. Nous ne réparons pas les pièces mécaniques de votre voiture, mais connaissons quelques ateliers très bons et bon marché. 

Vous pouvez utiliser notre adresse comme adresse de livraison pour Amazon, par exemple. Mais nous pouvons également fournir une aide à la traduction ou une assistance dans les hôpitaux / centres médicaux. Depuis plusieurs années, nous sommes le contact pour les urgences médicales sur les bateaux de croisière dans la région. Nous savons que dans de telles situations, il peut être très difficile de se débrouiller dans un pays que vous ne connaissez pas comme le vôtre. 
Comme nous vivons en Espagne depuis 15 ans et que nous parlons l'anglais et le français ainsi que l'espagnol, nous sommes préparés à de nombreuses situations. 
___________________________

Mit unserer voll ausgestatteten Werkstatt und jahrelanger Erfahrung bieten wir alle Reparaturen innerhalb und außerhalb Ihres Overlander- oder Wohnmobil-Lebensraums an. Fenster austauschen, Wasserpumpen reparieren, Scharniere wechseln, Solarpaneele installieren oder was auch immer es sein mag. Da wir unseren eigenen Overlander bauen, sind wir auch gerne bereit, bei einem Kaffee zu plaudern. Wir reparieren keine mechanischen Teile Ihres Autos, kennen aber einige sehr gute und günstige Werkstätten. 

Sie können unsere Adresse als Versandadresse für z.B. Amazon verwenden. Wir können aber auch Übersetzungshilfe oder Hilfe in Krankenhäusern / medizinischen Zentren leisten. Wir sind seit mehreren Jahren Ansprechpartner für medizinische Notfälle auf Kreuzfahrtschiffen in der Region. Wir wissen, dass es in solchen Situationen sehr schwierig sein kann, in einem Land zurechtzukommen, das man nicht so gut kennt wie sein eigenes. 
Da wir seit 15 Jahren in Spanien leben und sowohl Englisch und Französisch als auch Spanisch sprechen, sind wir auf viele Situationen vorbereitet.

name: cliff close to oilrig
description: here are at least three different spots where you can stay. check the pictures and the red line. its close to the oil rig. for the initial entrance check the other spot here on ioverlander. no shades. you can walk to the beach, its a stone beach, no sand. you need a good ground clearance but not neccessary 4wd.

name: natural pools
description: some natural pools. good for a swim. a lot of people here.

name: Small Laguna
description: nice place with a view. also good for a swim. a lot of people. here is also a parking space where you can stay for a night

name: beach place
description: a lot of space, a lot of other campers. easy accessible. wind protected

name: Ifonche
description: a lot of space with an amazing view. here is also a paragliding start point. can be very windy since you are on top of a hill. easy accessible.

name: Tent spot in pine trees
description: From the pullout walk to the electrical line tower and then look down to your left. There is a flat spot just big enough for a tent. Pretty well hidden from traffic on the road but if anyone happens to use the pullover you will be seen. It’s a really nice spot if you don’t mind not being 100% stealth.

name: Taucho Landingsite
description: this is the place where the paragliders land when they start at Taucho. A lot of space. some cool natural pools which are good for a swim. easy accessible. here are also a lot of places a little bit further away from the coastline. check google maps Satellite images.

name: Calpe parking
description: parking place in the middel of the city - very close to the mountain

name: Next to the Chinyero Natural park
description:
We spent one night at this little "roundabout". Quiet, only some dogs barking at night. Only a few cars passed by or stayed here while the people went into the Nationalpark. 
Please take your rubbish with you and leave the place clean!
Nice view of Teide in the back!

name: Tent site wild camp
description: Because the nearby Morro de Santiago camping zone is closed I found this for an evening. Follow the dirt road until it becomes very poor condition. It will go down very steeply to a sharp corner. At this corner there’s is a flat spot perfect for a tent. The road is in such bad condition that there will definitely be no cars on it.

name: Fajana piscina’s
description:
An official free camperparking on a nice spot with view on the ocean. Close to the lovely swimming pools where there are cold showers, toilets and water.
Also nice flat spots close around (and area closer tot sea or a little bit uphill waking distance) to put a tent for a night of wildcamping, since officially it’s not allowed on this parking. Picknicktables provided.

name: Car Break-ins
description: In the places along the gravel road, there are  frequently car break-ins by burglary gangs from campo hermoso.

name: flat hill
description: A big round flat space with a stunning view. the entrance to the durt road is between some houses. It looks like you are driving on private property but just befor the asphalt road ends, a dirt road on your right begins and leads to this place. There is no mobil conncetion here so you are completly offline.

name: Playa de Tapachuga
description: Big flat space in a valley. Here are a lot of campers and long term campers/hippies. No mobile connection. Tap water and toilets available. Stone beach is good for a swim and fishing. There is also a picknick area. Quiet at night. Up the hill in the town is a small supermarket.

name: Playa del Medio
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

not a lot of space and pretty full with vans but a nice place

name: Mar & Luis Ruiz
description:
A more than friendly and very secure place to store your 4x4 just north of Madrid, close (15 min) to Madrid Int Airport.
Mar & Luis are overlanders themselves.

name: Playa de la Caleta
description:
The most beautiful beach on La Gomera (according to the internet). 
We spent one quite night here. Could be very busy in summer. 
Downstairs at the beach there are toilets (okayish) and an old shower. 
There is also a little house, probably a bar in summertime. 
The way up to the parking is a little bumpy, drive slowly. Mobile connection is ok/working.
Some small cats strolling around the beach, so if you come here they will be happy about some cat food :)

name: natural pool
description: natural pool. good for a swim. nice place.

name: Playa de Ávalo
description:
We spent one quiet night here. Parking right next to the beach. Could be more crowded in summertime. 
Mobile connection is sometimes working, sometimes not!
Before the parking there is private property (with a fence arround), here lives a man with four dogs.
Please keep the place clean!

name: Toilettes and water
description: in the parking garage there are suprisingly clean toilets. there is also tap water available where you can refil water with a canister

name: Bar Parada
description: Bar to drink "Barraquito" and eat almond cockies, a cafe speciality on La Palma :) you can have it with or without liquor43.

name: El Pinalejo
description:
Moderator Note: User confirmed this water source is drinkable - It is a official tapwater spot from the village.

natural water spring, where you can refill your water bottle/canister. tap water.

name: toiltes and shower
description: toilets and shower at the beach. you can also refil water canisters at the shower on the beach. toilets are open between 07:00 and 19:00

name: Área recreativa Los Galguitos
description:
Parking place with playground. We spent one quiet night here. It's like in a small valley protected with high cliffs/rocks around, in the middle of a town.
Good mobile connection. Some car noise from the street in the morning.

name: San Miguel de Cornejo
description: directly after the river/stream crossing - it is next to farmers tracks - good signal

name: Waterfall parking 7kms along dirt from Riodeva
description: Quiet, isolated in pine woods with nice rocks around, easy or longer hiking here, great water source, 3 or 4 waterfalls along the river.

name: down the cliffs
description: amazing place with a lot of space. the road is very adventurous,  you need 4x4 and a high ground clearance. not recommended by rain or bad weather in general. no/very difficult acces to the sea. we did not sleep here. very good mobile connection. a lot of cactus figs which you can eat.

name: Pizzeria La Locanda
description:
Delicious pizza. You can choose between normal dough and black dough. 
Price range between 6 and 13 Euros. 
You can also choose starters, pasta or salads.

name: La Terrasse
description: The owners of the restaurant are a friendly French couple. You can have for example, breakfast, brunch, lunch or Tapas with wine. also Crepes here. Open Mo-Fr 9-18 and Sa 9-14, So closed. Food was good, European prices.

name: Tajinaste
description: Dirtroad parking space between hotels. Enough space for multiple vehicles, not far from sea. Windy like everywhere on the east side. 10 min. from Santa Cruz.

name: Dragon Chino
description: Next to the Shell fuel station there is a big china "dragon chino" supermarket. this is a typical china store where you find everything and with everything i mean everything. if its not super super special and you can't find it here, you will probably not find it on the island

name: Residência los Conejos
description:
Perfect for Motorbikes and Camper. Big parking inside the yard. Very nice roof terrace. Private and common rooms are available. I pay Euro 33.00 for a privat room. 
It was simple and clean .  Restaurant in the same building. The owner is a old couple.

name: Pizzeria Regina Margherita
description: Very tasty pizza napoletana. probably the best pizza on the island. pizza costs between 4.50 and 6.50 for the normal pizzas. it's difficult to get a parking place for a car.

name: Piscina Natural La Maceta
description: Camping next to natural pools. With dumping station for caravans. Toilets available and a restaurant.

name: Valbona BBQ.
description: A good place for a stop and a bbq. Not hard to find. Close to the main road, but no noise at all. No amenities other than a stone shelter.

name: san agustin del Guadalix
description: potable water free y the street near a Park

name: Pino de la Cruz
description:
Next to the mirador is a little path leading to a nice edge with great view (when there are no clouds..) just before the mirador is a space next to the road for vans / little campers. The path is maybe accessible with small vans (not sure since I travel by bike). Perfect for hikers / cyclists. Super quiet in the night and birds all around! 
On the mirador is a picknicktable.
Connection with phone /4G

name: Playa de Tacorón
description: Beautiful playa with a lot of lagunas for swiming, fishing, snorcheling and diving. places for barbecue available, toilets and water, too. quiet at night. The mobile connection is only available direct at the water (4g). no internet where you park the car

name: Valhondo Free Campsite
description:
Urban free campsites with facilities for empty gray water from motorhome.
Authorized stay: 48 hours. Camping is not allowed. The parking area is a little above the water loading and unloading point. Natural pool and playground a few meters away. The hotel and shopping services are in the town, about 500 m. More info: +34 927 197 373.

name: Next to the Road place
description: A nice spot to spend a night or two. Great view of the gorge and a 5min walk to the river. It is next to the road and traffic is scarce. There is a small finca down the way but wasn’t occupied by the time I was here. I guess if you leave a bit of space for the owner to get there it will be no problem.

name: Little Texas Motorhome Park
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. 

Little Texas Tabernas were awarded the 3rd best Motorhome Park in Spain by CamperContact in 2021. We are a small family owned business located on the gateway to the Tabernas Desert with amazing mountain views. Our Wild West Theme compliments the numerous Western towns and filming locations in the area.

Our facilities include:

Electricity  (6 Amp)
Filtered Drinking Water 
Hot Showers
Toilets
Waste Water Station (Black and Grey)
WiFi
Washing Machine
Bar
Shop
Freshly baked bread and Pastries baked on site every morning 
Swimming Pool 
Solar Heated Hot Water

Coming Soon.....

Western Themed Restaurant and Bar
Heated Swimming Pool
Solar Electricity 

We pride ourselves on providing a relaxing location for your stay here at Little Texas and look forward to hopefully seeing you soon!

name: Camping La Font
description: Nice camping, excellent as a base camp to travel arround the Matarraña region that is full of POI.

name: castillo almonacid de Toledo
description:
Up to the castle of Almonacid there is a esplanade to sleep with your camper van or motorhome. Quiet place with good views. 
Visit the castle on foot or by bike, it is full of history.

name: Superb view on the mountains
description: Access by 4x4 only. Small patch of grass, not really flat but once you take a look at the view, it doesn't really matter. Close to the woods, lots of sheep around. We saw the Shepherd in the morning and he didn't care that we were camping there. Amazing view. Please keep this place clean (even if the sheep don't...

name: Area Puente de San Miguel
description: Parking area to unload and load water near small shops and ATMs.

name: Camp de Tir
description: Shooting range, restaurant. Parking. toilets --- Campo de tiro, restaurante. Parking. Aseos

name: Free parking bufones de pria
description: Parking with picnic zone to go to the Bufones de Pría. Place to spend the night in motorhome (no camping).

name: Near Solius Rock Climbing
description: A nice quiet place a few hundred meters down a washed out path. In dry conditions probably reachable in a normal small van. We met some people who live close by and they were okay with us camping here. Their dogs might pay you a visit (they both have a collar with their name and a phone number). Good phone service.

name: Antenas Aguadulce
description: Only 4x4 with gearbox, very broken road.  Dead end road, very quiet at night, day hikers.  spectacular views.

name: Parking lot at Playa de Mónsul
description: Parking lot close to the beach, quite far from the next town so very quiet. There were several other campers with us in december. Little privacy but the beach is very beautiful, you can even go surfing here and there are some nice hiking trails!

name: Parking lot with view of Gibraltar
description: A big parking lot right next to the beach with a wonderful view. No facilities. Beach shower didn’t work when we were there. No camping allowed in the surrounding area, the police tolerated/ignored it on the asphaltic area.

name: Antenas Aguadulce 2
description: Only 4x4 with gearbox, very broken road.  Dead end road, very quiet at night, day hikers.  spectacular views.

name: Cuesta La Palma Park
description:
Public park in Cuesta La Palma. Hard dirt and gravel, picnic tables, and potable water. When asking locals where to camp, multiple people suggested the park.

Probably too bright and has highway noise, but otherwise a fine place for one night.

Visited by bicycle. Not suitable for car or rv travel.

name: Santuario Nuestra Señora del Viso
description: Small mountain church. Nice place for two campers, vans and other rigs.

name: Riverside
description: Great place for wild camping. Next to a river. Calm night with the birds singing.

name: Santuario Nuestra Señora Brezo
description: Incredible place with lots of spots. No cell phone signal.

name: Casares
description: Overnight parking with water and garbage dump

name: Camping el Cares
description: Small but well equipped campsite just outside town.

name: Roadside
description: Plenty of free parking by this park. Spent one night. A few other good places around this neighborhood as well… No services. If you need a restroom, you can find one at the Aldi Market, next to McDonalds, at the main avenue a couple of blocks away.

name: Embalse de la Sarra
description: Water source right next to the road at the end if the lake. opposite to a small café

name: Camping Moncayo
description: Established site which apparently is open all year. Good toilets and showers and flat camping with electricity if you want it. We paid €20 for Land Rover, 2 people and our cat.

name: Pull out
description:
Close to the Alhambra parking lots, but free. Stopped here to have lunch. Didn’t spend the night, but there’s plenty of trash on the floor that I assume people come here often for the view.
Space for 2 Vans kind of flat. No services.

name: Gas Station
description: Repsol with a restaurant and hot shower for €2. Truck stop.

name: Free dump station in Mora
description:
3 parking places where you can stay up to 72h. Each with its own gray water drain.
There’s one black water common drain for all (marked WC) and there’s water at the wall. All free.

name: Wild  Mountain Camp
description: Beautiful place close to a MOT track with a beautiful view over Land and Coast

name: Gas station with RV dump and water service
description: Gas station with RV dump and water service. Free.

name: Barcelona
description: This is the place for campers in Barcelona. Next to a gas station, where you can pay €4 for shower. 12 minute There’s also laundry available. Lots of campers in a perfect parking.

name: Pizzeria La Cabaña
description: The food here is exceptionally good! The salad, the pizza, the gnocchi and the dessert were all great!

name: pine trees
description:
Beautiful place not too far from the Interstate 4
At least good for one night...

name: Área de autocaravanas "El Cañaveral"
description: Large RV parking with a nice chiringuito-type bar. Water fountains, electricity and illumination available. Nice views from Chinchilla from bellow. 15 km away from Albacete. The village has an historical old town filled with charming streets and plenty of secrets to discover. The caves surronding the upper part and the 14th century castle should not be missed.

name: Area Malaga  Beach
description: Area Malaga Beach. 16 km from the airport. A place for motorhomes. There is water, electricity, a place to discharge dirty water. There is a small shop, you can rent bikes and order a car.

name: Camper parking for motorhomes
description: Beatiful parking places for campers vehicles. Fresh water. Collecting Black waters. Impresive sea view. Nice restaurant with sea food.

name: Camper Area. Outeiro de Rei
description: Beatiful place clase to the Village. Organized for Camping Cars and Campers. All services free, including electricity

name: Monte Subiedes
description: little picnic-place at roadside with view. Drinking water and seating available.

name: Camping Olite
description:
Large place with lots of residential bungalows. Lots of space for camping cars on grass. No shade.
Toilets and showers are run down and dirty.

name: La BEGUR de Segur Camp de cap
description: +PARKING CAMPING CAR and Dumpstation........................

name: Camping Reina Isabel
description: Nice family campsite near Granada. Bus stop next to campsite.

name: Parking next to Camping Osuna
description: Big parking lot with many trees and bushes right next to camping Osuna. It’s clean & for free, we slept here two nights & had no problems. Other campers were also around. It’s next to a street but not very loud. There’s a free public toilet in about 4 min. walking distance right next to the stadion and the parks nearby have small drinking water fountains. Walking distance to the next metro station is about 8-10 min., it takes around 25 min. to get into the city center.

name: Camping El Bierzo
description:
Mid size camp ground on open grass with trees. Nice owner. 
4.50€ per person, 6.70€ per campingcar. 4.50€ for electricity. 
TEL. 987 56 25 15.   www.campingbierzo.com

name: Rodamoto
description: Rodamoto AKA tyre heaven. Insane stock of tyres for Motos. Great friendly people and fair prices.

name: cascadas del hueznar
description: Nice spot close to the cascades and waterfall. there's also a part for BBQ.

name: wildcamping with view
description: lovely place to stay!!! on the one side huge rocks and on the other side a wonderful beach (no swimmimg). stunning sunsets and ocean view   :)

name: Edalmoto
description: Good moto shop with parts, oil, gear and a mechanic.

name: Hostel San Andres I
description: Nice clean hostel. €32 / night for a private room with bath.

name: Splash Bath Brook
description: Little stream. Directly off the road down the bank (north side) by the bridge, but vehicles can't see you!

name: Big Tree
description: Not hidden from the road, but there's hardly any traffic, and drivers have to be looking at the curve in the road. From the tree there's a little path down to the lake. Along the shore here there's quite a few pullouts which would be fine for camping... this one seemed a bit more protected.

name: Rest Stop
description: Rest stop along the viasverde. There's a potable water tap, picnic table, and flat ground for pitching a tent (though it's probably not supposed to be used as a campground). I didn't stay here but wished I had.

name: Hidden spot by stream
description: Beautiful wild camp spot. Not visible from the road, and right by clean water. Only drawback is some thorny bushes, and there isn't a huge amount of space if you have a really large tent. Otherwise, excellent.

name: By the River. Cyclists only
description: Upstream of the bridge, and along the trail on the north side of the river. If you go about 50 m along the trail (haul your bike over some rocks) there's a lovely flat spot up on the left past an abandoned building. Room for 2 tents if needed.

name: Beautiful Spot
description: On the south side of the south end of the Ubend in the road. Take the side road until you feel like stopping. There's a beautiful stream and quiet spots for a tent.

name: Mountain Views
description: Lots of options here. Several gravel paths lead to possible camp options. No water. Very quiet.

name: Coll de Turbians
description: Coll de Turbians is tarmac if you comes from Gisclareny road, it isn't if you comes from Bagà. The place is very quiet and paceful in the middle of prepyrenees. no water near this area.

name: Refugi Sant Jordi
description: https://www.feec.cat/fem-muntanya/refugis/refugi/refugi-sant-jordi/

name: les geudins
description:
very beautiful city, under the umbrella pines, with barbecue, tables and benches for eating and sleeping.
--
très beau cite, sous les pins parasols, avec barbecue, tables et bancs pour manger, et dormir.

name: El Grado
description: place for camping car, wild camping, break

name: El Burro Blanco
description: Wonderfull campsite, 25 places in the Nature. Nice host. Not for big Cars

name: Los Manzanos
description: Nice, shady campground with aprox. 40 places for Campers. Quiet and clean. Aprox. 12 km to old town.

name: Camping playa Otur
description:
Nice, small, shady campground. 600m from the beach. Small restaurant, nice owner. 
Payed 25€ for campervan, 2 people with electricity. 
www.campingotur.com
info@campingotur.com
+34 9856 40117

name: Camping Macheira
description: Very nice campground in the nature. Small, quiet, well equipped. Swimming Pool, WiFi at the reception.

name: Camping playa Sauces
description:
Mid. size camp ground. Little shade, bar, clean ablutions. 
No restaurant but bar 
Payed: 20€ for 2people campervan with electricity 
Washing machine and tumbler 
cplayasauces@hotmail.com

name: Playa de Gulpiyuri
description:
This is the cutest beach, and supposedly the smallest one on the world.
The water gets here only during high tide, and you can enjoy a private beach if you’re lucky. Road to get here is narrow and you will get some tall grass touching your paint. No 4x4 needed, but if it rains, 4x4 may help.

name: Playa de Gulpiyuri
